Reviews.Title: “No window, hole in the wall.”
Reviews.Author: debora s
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in the Kirketon Boutique Hotel Sydney which was 'self rated' 5 stars, but the room they gave me was actually a hovel with no functioning window or view to the outside. I didn't stay - but they still charged me! Upon being shown my room, I realised that this was nowhere near 5 stars. The room was 3x3m, the carpet was dirty, there was a persistent buzzing from a wall fluorescent bulb that could not be turned off. But the main issue was that there was no window. The old fashioned window was covered with opaque vinyl and sealed shut. I know of no possible hotel in Sydney that could call themselves 5 star while having no window, let alone a window that is sealed shut and blacked out. I returned to the front desk immediately and requested another room, happy to to pay more (the room I was staying in cost $200 on Last Minute.). There were no other rooms, so I told the front desk, that I could not possibly stay there and left the hotel. I assumed they would credit my AMEX, but no, I received my statement and there was no reversal. The Kirketon has so far refused to remove the charge for a room which was falsely advertised and in which I did not stay. Bed service, trickery, and a terrible room.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are great!”
Reviews.Author: dreamonixx
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights and booked a small room. The room was exactly as promised, a small room. I didn't want anything big because I was out and about enjoying Sydney so it was just perfect. Very clean and comfortable bed I must add. Loved that the staff looked up and greeted you on arrival and departure and they had personality....not stiff and unfriendly. The bar down stairs is not part of the hotel I don't think but it's amazing and I highly recommend a visit for cocktails. Great coffee shops around this area so try Tiger Bakery for coffee, its only a street away. It kind of annoys me when people moan about the rooms being small. You get what you buy so read the web sites carefully and only be ready for what you get. This hotel offers free wifi in your room which is excellent for Australia. I say give it a go.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: RoseburnGreen
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here for a bit time in the city of Sydney during a holiday visiting relatives on the Northern Beaches. This hotel is in a fantastic part of town with some of Sydney's best bars and restaurants on its doorstep. The hotel itself is clean and the staff all seemed helpful and pleasant. Our room was small but gave us all we required as a base to explore the city, the mini bar prices are ridiculously expensive although with so many options nearby you would only require to use it in an emergency. For people after location, a bed and a clean bathroom then you won't go wrong here, if your looking for a hotel with large rooms to spend time in then I wold not be so sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good not great”
Reviews.Author: Marcus L
Reviews.Content: Hotel was OK. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the bar downstairs was pretty nice. The hotel is quite a nice old building that has been fairly recently renovated, but the renovations are of quite low quality. It looks quite modern but the paintwork and and general finish is pretty shoddy. The room was quite small but clean and adequate for our needs. The location was great. The main problem was that their is basically no soundproofing and we were woken at 6am every morning by one of the other guests having a screaming argument (not even next door, a few rooms away) Would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting and good experience.”
Reviews.Author: MNtravelers7
Reviews.Content: The Kirketon Hotel has a very unique feel to it. There are creepy movies playing in the hallways with long red carpets and mirrors lining the hallways making you feel like you are in a bit of a fun house. The room and amenities were very nice as well as the service. Nice fun restaurants not far while also a 20-25 minute walk right downtown Sydney. I would recommend for a different hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location - very cute boutique!”
Reviews.Author: Maddi A
Reviews.Content: A great boutique - this is my choice for any business trip. The locaiton is perfect for getting to meetings in East Sydney. The rooms are small yet perfect for a short stay - The beds are comfy & only downside is the staris up to the room levels.

Reviews.Title: “Dumpsville”
Reviews.Author: Dumpsville
Reviews.Content: Staff pleasant and helpful. We should have realised from the drapes hanging down from the ceiling in the reception that it was going to be a horror nite... The rooms are dark and dingy the sofa looks like something you would find on a verge bulk collection, the bed had wheels missing the painted walls looked like that they let school kids pratice there painting skills in fact pre primary kids... The bathroom hahahaha now that's the best I got in the shower and turned it on, well the shower head is a tin can with holes in it screwed to the ceiling with the best water saving shower head ! I felt dirtier getting out the shower... Sorry but what a dump... The manager was very polite and understanding and gave me a massive discount.. Top marks for him but ruined my stay in Sydney , but hey what an experience ..

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay at the Kirketon”
Reviews.Author: Justinivixch
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Kirketon Hotel 20-24 January 2012. Must say that I had a great stay because of the hotel's service and excellent location. It's in Darlinghurst, with proximity to the shops along Paddington, the cosy neighbourhood of Surry Hill with quaint shops, cafes, restaurants, and easy access to bus connections to beaches along the Eastern Coastal Walk. The hotel is along Darlinghurst road, near William Street, and parallel to Victoria Street, with a good choice of restaurants/cafes/cafeteria, an amazing gelato shop (Messina), convenience stores, a small supermarket - all the amenities you'll need etc. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Checking in/out was casual, relaxed and fuss free. The rooms are stylish, clean and very comfortable. My friends met me at the bar downstairs for drinks, and the vibe was lively and happening.

Reviews.Title: “Opted for just plain poor”
Reviews.Author: jakamos
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews here and finding many above average reviews I opted for this over the Mantra 2 Bond Street as it was for a honeymoon trip therefore a 'boutique hotel' experience should have been more appropriate - WRONG Firstly - this is NOT a boutique hotel (note to Kirketon management team - if you get a chance check out the Luxe Manor in Kowloon Hong Kong which IS a boutique hotel for inspiration) We arrived at 8:30am to a warm friendly reception and an explanation that as it can get noisy downstairs (gulp) would we prefer to wait until after 2pm for a 2nd floor room which would be quieter. OK let's go out for a few hours and kill time.... Return at 2pm to the same 'friendly' receptionist who then after a while standing there said 'how can i help you?' A bit shocked I responded 'we would like to check in?' and then was asked my name again having already given credit card details earlier. When I pointed out that we had already met I was given a curt 'well many people pass by here at reception...it is a hotel' Wow what a change 5 hours makes! Then I was told that there was no lift and he 'hadn't had a chance to get luggage to the room'. He looked panicked that he may be asked to still take the cases so we said we would take them ourselves. When he brought them right around before I had a chance to speak further he looked really irritatated that we wanted to get into the room and drop some shopping and hand luggage first. Great start... Inside the room which IS tiny - regardless of location or room options these are SMALL. There is less then 3 ft of space between the end of the the double bed and the wall. The bathroom was grotty - grey tiles with dull and mouldy grout everywhere. No bath and standard toiletries of shower gel / shampoo / conditioner nothing else (not very boutiquey). Basically my husband summed it up when he said - it is a hostel with some posh trimmings. Harsh but as far as the the standard room is concerned, true. Public areas are better - nice low lighting with interesting and soothing design. There is no room service - unless you count calling reception who will order take away from a local restaurant and deliver to your room at a much elevated price. The internet which is $15AUS per day was not working the entire time I was there (10 long days) so as far as the managements comments on an earlier review about not keeping hard copies of phone books, brochures etc goes - well this was a good example of why you SHOULD keep them. There is no breakfast option - period. Downstairs the restaurant and bar are managed separately. Again most boutique hotels would have this as standard. However the bar is a fun vibrant place to be at night and seemed popular but as this doesn't belong to 8 hotels - kind of irrelevant to this review. The location IS great - very central to Kings Cross / Darlinghurst area which is just as well as if you stay there you will likely want to be out most of the time. The rooms were not serviced well - if at all. Most days somebody came in and made the bed. That was it.... no hoovering - no cleaning in the bathroom - nothing. I experimentally decided not to clean away a long black hair from a previous guest in the shower cubicle - it is probably still there. One day we left a little later at a 10:30am and came back to not even a made bed (annoying as the linen doesn't fit correctly and comes undone when you sleep - the duvets don't even have a cover - just a sheet top and bottom) When we told reception later we were told it was because we had a DnD sign on. This was removed when we left the room and we even said hello to the housekeeping boy when leaving the room. Basically the housekeeping is bad - never cleaned or hoovered. We were there 6 days before they even changed the bed for fresh linen (which also didn't fit) Toiletries were sparcely replaced too. You can't open the windows due to 'health and safety' whatever that means. I think my main problem is that I was expecting a boutique hotel which the kirketon really isn't. Maybe my own mental definition of boutique hotel is off but I believe it means a small nicely designed and maintained hotel with all the trimmings you would expect. (anyway to prevent a disagreement on this try: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boutique_hotel for a genrally accepted definition. I would especially ask the management team to review this and cross reference it with the kirketon.) Well it is certainly small...and the design is nice but that's it. If that's all your after - then don't worry - enjoy your stay. If you expect more than please - spare yourself the upset when you arrive and book elsewhere. By the way the rude ish receptionist was not seen the rest of our stay and all the other reception staff (all male) were so nice and friendly so I hope none of them get told off. THis is not a staffing issue - it is a management and housekeeping issue. It could so easily be fantastic with the right services; breakfast option, room service option, cleaning better, more toiletries, bathrooms updated, room furniture updated etc etc. but right now it needs addressing to be anywhere near what it appears to be on the website. I feel I could go on but in the interest of putting people off reading the review and also rubbing salt into the wounds I think this will do. Needless to say I won't be booking an 8 hotel again or recommending them until I hear they have improved. The extra rating above Terrible is for the location and the staff. Therefore I opted for just 'Poor'

Reviews.Title: “Nice Sydney hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kath2011Norway
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Kirketon for 4 nights in November 2011. The hotel is situated perfectly, it's quiet, but still nearby everything. Across the streets there are many coffee shops and great places for breakfast. The hotel is decorated quite dark, but is very stylish. We had a small room, but for 4 nights that was ok. Loved the hotel because of the super friendly staff and the location! Just a small stroll up to Paddington and Surrey Hills (<- very cool area!)

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: conorbuggy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as it was in a perfect location for exploring Sydney. The rooms were lovely, the staff were lovely and the location was great. The cocktail lounge was fabulous and we had some really delightful meals in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in town”
Reviews.Author: jozieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews i was a bit weary but was pleasantly surprised. Firstly, the service was outstanding and very helpful. We didn't find it too dark at all, it's more like mood lighting and gives the place a bit of quirky atmosphere. Yes, the rooms are small but you are in central Sydney! It's clean, reasonably new and great value. If you want the Hilton, go stay at the Hilton and pay 3 x as much! The Kirketon is great for a few days exploring the city and i'd recommend it to anyone. (we stayed on a sunday night so can't really comment on the noise; it was really quiet)

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Stig x
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, nice hotel, nice rooms but they were small, i had to go outside to change my oppinion!

Reviews.Title: “In a lovely area, but rooms small & dark”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy2010
Reviews.Content: wanted to stay in a small boutique hotel, so chose the Kirketon. Area was lovely, and was nice to be out of the CBD. Hotel within walking distance of the train to CBD for shopping & sight seeing. Standard rooms were extremely small, and due to window being heavily glazed this made it feel like you were sleeping in a closet. Room was ok for one person, but if i'd been there with my partner, it would have been a squash! No real reception area, just straight into the hotel bar, which was ok if you wanted to stay up drinking all night.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: kathy_kangaroo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December for a concert down the road in Moore Park (Cricket Grounds) We caught a taxi there but it was only a short 15 minute walk back. I got a deal for $189 for a premium room, wifi and breakfast, which was really excellent value. Darlinghurst offers a really great array of bars and restaurants. We had a nice meal and Monkey Mya Tequila Bar on Victoria Street, and I know that the Victoria Rooms are a really lovely place to get some afternoon tea or a drink. The room was clean and basic, a little bit dark and gothic. The hallway was stiflingly hot though which I found a little odd. We had a very expensive drink in the bar downstairs, but didn't stay for long as the service was atrocious and it was near impossible to order a second drink. It wasn't even busy! The breakfast was across the road in a little cafe called Le Petite Creme, which was very nice. This is a great base for a weekend, but I wouldn't want to stay here more then two nights.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST Hotel experience ever don't stay here never never never”
Reviews.Author: traindriver129
Reviews.Content: Please don't ever allow yourself to be booked in at the Kirketon (Crapton) Hotel, absolutley the worst stay I have ever had anywhere, the hotel does'nt cater for you the tourist, needed a phone book on one of the days to be told te hotel had none?, most accommaxdation providers also have bochures on things to do, maps etc but nothing here folks. Then there's the room, we had a stadard room with a double bed, the room was so small the TV hung from the ceiling above the bed, the only way you could watch the TV was to lay on your back. The room and the Hotel is dark and dingy inside nothing like the photo's on the web site, Don't plan to sleep as the noise from the downstairs bar which goe's to the early hours of the morning is so loud they don't care about YOU. I'm so upset with my stay I will be instructing my agent to get a full refund and by the way the price was not cheap paid nearly $200.00 a night NZ, could have stayed at a proper 5 star hotel for that. KIRKETON HOTEL YOU SHOULD BE ASHAMED OF YOURSELF, THANKS FOR RUINING OUR 26TH WEDDING ANNIVERSARY.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelguySF
Reviews.Content: The Kirketon hotel is in a great location. The staff there is really amazing. They are so friendly and helpful that it really makes a huge difference. Can't say enough good things about the staff. We stayed in what was supposed to be a Premium Double room on the first floor. The room was size was what we expected, small by U.S. standards, but not tiny or crowded. The room had a window that was coated over and could not be opened. So, you couldn't see out. There was no view anyway as it would have looked into the wall of the building next door which was about 3 feet away (the bathroom window opened). As stated in other reviews, the rooms are dark. There just isn't much lighting. However that is how it's designed and we didn't really mind much. There was a separate closet area that contained the mini fridge, shelving and hangars. There is indeed a lot of noise from the restaurant and bar located on the ground floor. The restaurant and bar is very very popular. We received a letter from the hotel management in our room on Saturday letting us know it would be loud and they provided earplugs. If you are a light sleeper or don't want to sleep with earplugs, then another hotel is probably for you. We stayed up late, so for us it was not an issue. Overall, the room was in good condition. However, it's probably due for some refurbishing in the near future. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. We would probably stay here again, but might also look for a similar hotel in the same area. It would depend on price vs. quality for us. For the price we paid, the hotel met our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “VERY noisy indeed!!!”
Reviews.Author: hilaryw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located and good value which makes it a tempting option. The rooms are VERY small indeed and most have only showers. I went for the most expensive option and ended up with a decent sized room with a bathroon which boasted bath and shower. It was very comfortable and nicely decorated in modern Sydney style. However the NOISE from the downstairs bar was so deafening I could not sleep at all. If you like to sleep at night this is not the hotel for you! The lively bar plays loud thumping music until late and is full of young noisy people you can hardly get in the door past the drinkers congregated on the footpath outside. I had heard this hotel was noisy so I asked for a room on the top floor but even so the music was so loud it made sleep impossible.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the City”
Reviews.Author: M1311
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kirketon for one night mid-week as I had a conference in the CBD and my companies policy with respect to paying for hotels in Sydney doesn't stretch to a CBD 5star establishment, on reflection I'm glad it didn't as my stay at the Kirketon far exceeded my expectations. Check-in was friendly and efficient and I was informed that I had been granted a double upgrade.The room was indeed on the grand scale with respect to size. Being at the back (as requested) there was no view to speak of but the extra room and the enormous bed made up for the lack of a view. The room was immaculately clean, the bed extremely comfortable and the bathroom whilst on the small side was spotlessly clean and well maintained, as mentioned in other reviews it the bathroom was on the dark side but I think this adds to the atmosphere rather than detracts from it. I visited the back bar (the front bar was closed) which was a fantastic find, the bar staff were creating some fantastic looking cocktails and the place had a great energy even on a Wed night, it is definitely a class above your average hotel bar. The other great aspect of the stay was the breakfast which is taken across the road at a cafe which sounds unconventional but is infact a masterstroke as the perfectly cooked breakfast with juice, coffee and freshly baked baguette would probably qualify as the best hotel breakfast I've ever had. Negatives: well there weren't many, I did ask if they had a Blackberry charger and whilst they were able to provide one promptly it wasn't the correct one for my model of phone. Its also worth being mindful of your personal safety if wandering the nearby streets of Darlinghurst/Kings Cross too. Other than that there was nothing negative worth reporting. I would highly recommend the Kirketon for business people or couples and I'll definitely book in again the next time I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Dank, dingy, and busted”
Reviews.Author: J R
Reviews.Content: The worn carpet on the stairs should have been the first clue that this property would not live up to its description. Once I entered the room it smelled musty like it had been shuttered for weeks. The bathroom was the pits. The sink was broken in several places. The newly installed rain shower head spilled out all over the floor. The shower has virtually no lighting. Previous repairs in the shower have not been covered.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike1333
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business from the and agree that the staff are great, friendly faces after 25 hours travelling are always helpful. The rooms are small but if your on your own there fine and it adds to the character of the hotel. Business travellers be warned however the cafe across the road doesn't take credit cards and the lovely restaurant downstairs which serves superb food is quite pricey....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and staff, rooms not so much”
Reviews.Author: phillysilver
Reviews.Content: Had a pretty good stay at the Kirketon. But the room situation is not great, so I can't give a great score. Mercedes is like a dream staff member, she made me feel welcome before I even booked my room, and is an asset to the hotel. The other staff members I met were also fantastic. The location of this hotel cannot be beat. I would way prefer staying in this neighborhood than in the CBD on the weekend, especially if not traveling for work. My only issue with the hotel was the room itself. My first room was so dark and dismal that it was really depressing. The window was frosted and there was a sign that said "do not open". Thank God it did. The carpets are dark, the bathroom tiles are dark, it just felt so grim. I understand that some people like a dark and chic kind of look. And the hotel even offers to give you a floor lamp if you want one. But in this case, I felt like the dark carpets and tiles are an excuse for not cleaning as much. I can't tell you that the room was unclean, because everything was too dark to tell. But there was no question that the bathroom was not sterile. A quick wipe down would have been the only thing required given the lack of light. Also, the bed was awful. If I were the manager, I would rip out the dark carpets, and replace with dark wood (if dark was needed), would lighten things up a bit, and would do something about the grim bathrooms. I was mercifully upgraded to a bigger front room on the second night. Again, carpets were black and the bathroom was dark. The benefit was that the windows were big and not frosted. But there seemed to be only a few rooms like that. I understand that the room rates are decent and the rooms are small because of the value. But I don't think I will be staying again if I had other choices. The service is certainly a HUGE benefit. As is the location, and the bar downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant service”
Reviews.Author: pimptyltda
Reviews.Content: This place took us by surprise. When we first arrived, the receptionist was extremely friendly and helpful. He let us check in early and leave our bags while we were out. It's in a great location just down from Kings Cross. The room was big (we were upgraded) and clean. We stayed Pn a Tuesday night and there was noise from the street, so I suspect that on a weekend it would be noisier still. Breakfast is served across the road at a lovely French cafe and was delicious! Overall we were very impressed!

Reviews.Title: “COMPACT! Not for everyone but very handy”
Reviews.Author: JTravels075
Reviews.Content: Ok â€“ so stayed here for 2 nights over the weekend â€“ Saturday night was noisy but nothing too bad â€“ was able to sleep â€“ although was freezing in the room and the split system would not turn over onto heating â€“ very annoying â€“ told reception in the morning and they had it fixed and a blanket placed in the room (could not work out why a blanket was not in the cupboard already â€“surely anything above a 3 star has a spare blanket in the room?) The rooms are small although I moved to a superior room for a very good price and was happy with it but the standard rooms are compact, clean and dark. The TVs are good with a great selection of stations â€“ with the Kirketon you get what you pay for â€“ a nice, clean, well equipped room, with a comfy bed in a GREAT position, close to everything. But be warned the bathrooms are DARK â€“ hard to put on makeup in and the shower is very dark so no personal grooming once the shower curtain is closed. The best lighting is in the actual room with a giant mirror behind the bed. Reception staff are great, friendly, enthusiastic and knowledgeable â€“ the place is noisy on Saturday night and the lobby can look like an empty night club in the morning with a funny smell â€“ but hey that adds to it â€“ during the week it all comes together as the perfect corporate hotel â€“ weekend perfect party place. Well that is Sydney after all isnâ€™t it?

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel with great character”
Reviews.Author: RobbieIlaria
Reviews.Content: I spent only 1 night there. Checked in late but the staff was friendly enough and gave all info. The an absolute jewel. Not facing the street, therefore very quiet. Big mirror behind the bed ... Nice black couch with black coffee table. The room was spacious enough and the bed very comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing this time ....”
Reviews.Author: Sue D
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Kirketon since 2007 and have returned over the years as i love its quirkiness, reasonable price and location. I was so disappointed with my recent 2 night stay (Friday and Saturday night) as the bar downstairs was soooo noisy! I had a really busy couple of days and had not bargained on broken sleep due to the thriving bar. There was no mention of it on the web page, nor on my booking confirmation and I did not check trip advisor this time before making the booking as I had stayed there previously. Ear plugs were supplied, though the foreign nature of them did not assist in the sleep process. What a shame! I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “good solid budget with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: satori99
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Kirketon. Yes, it's very dark and you almost cannot see your face in the mirror when you shave. Yes, the water comes out of the shower so slowly you might as well forget to get rid of the shampoo foam!!! Yes, it's noisy, the bar downstairs does not help. But, it's clean, cheap for sydney, easy to get to, plenty around to see. and if you are in sydney for one night only, well, it's perfect. I mean you don't have to live there, do you? The staff is super and very efficient. I'd stay again.... :-) Also, I was upgraded and had free internet :-) BONUS!

Reviews.Title: “Effortless cool does not make up for hideous bar noise”
Reviews.Author: haroldluntz
Reviews.Content: I'm suffering the loud bar noise on a Saturday night right now as I'm writing this review. It's really incredible the hotel didn't think a bit more about noise insulation. I can feel every base beat and conversation. The staff has informed me there is a party going on and it will end at 1 am. Ironically he had to yell on the phone to make himself heard above the noise. Apart from this major flaw the room is nicely decked out and it's clean. Great location and I think my room is a reasonable size for the price but the noise! If you're staying here on Saturday just stay out past 1 am or get some industrial strength earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “keep it that way despite nayer”
Reviews.Author: aspironz
Reviews.Content: I am not going to start a debate over Kirketon room size/value as this is personal preference, stayed at Westin once but have my reservation walked thru lobby after big night out seems out of place, saying that theres much to do when so don't spend much time doing somersault inroom, frontdesk always helpful, clean room (touch wood~ the time I stayed 2005/6, Oct09, March/June/Oct2010, and recently), nearby Tigerbakers cafe good brunch, and Fish Face yum seafood, you don't really need to go far for coffee fix or chow options. keep it that way.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: melbsmitch
Reviews.Content: I understand that this is a boutique hotel on a budget, but there are a few things you want when you stay in a hotel as a standard. 1. A good nights sleep 2. A clean bathroom 3. Informative staff The front desk staff failed to give any information on the hotel on arrival, including the correct location of the award winning bar Eau De Vie within the hotel. They also had real trouble trying to give directions to Ms G's in Potts Point. The bathroom was covered in mould and had one small light, at knee height. It was dangerous and not enjoyable at all. The bar (not Eau De Vie) the one we were directed to as being Eau De Vie, was opened till 1am. The loud music and sound of the people of talking/yelling in the bar kept us awake till 2am. There has been no attempt to tell guests on arrival of how loud the bar is on a Saturday night, nor has the hotel tried to sound proof the windows or doors of the room. Monocle Magazine recently rated the hotel as one of the best boutique hotels in Sydney. They obviously didn't stay there. I would not stay here again, and would not recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Location, Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: suzls17
Reviews.Content: There seems to be alot of complainers on this site if you wanted 5 star you are going to have to pay for it. This hotel was clean, really modern and nice rooms with great decor, excellent position and friendly staff. People who comment other wise are just picky whingers. For the price I dont think you could do better any where else. LOVED IT and will definitely stay again when next visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JayneBosnich
Reviews.Content: Our first experience with a 8Hotel boutique hotel in Sydney was in 09 or '10. Took our relatives from the U.S. and we loved the accommodations, the breakfast room everything. The people working at the hotels are clearly happy w/there employment. They can't seem to do enough for you. Excellent rooms were so modern in their decor. The rooms are a tad smaller than a standard room, but excellent use of the space is unbelievable. SO where do we stay now in Kings Cross, one of the 3or4 8Hotels or more. Next we're trying one that to me has an Italian flavor. Don't think because these are boutique hotels that the service and quality of items in the rooms will be less, NO.;......the sheets and blankets on our beds have been like new each time. The rooms are spotless and you get a HUGE screen TV. Coffee maker and bar and snacks. And the area has so much to look at day and night. EXCELLENT hotels and great places for morning breakfast or brunch. Just walk around the area, it's great. You will know that you are not at home. Relax and also go out and explore.

Reviews.Title: “smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: taniaack
Reviews.Content: We purchased the Autumn Deals package with a late check out and room upgrade...silly me didn't read the fine print which stated "subject to availability" . We got stuck in a room the size of a matchbox, with a ridiculous bed made from 2 single beds. If I had known this would have been the case I would have paid the extra for a larger room. I had wanted to stay at the Kirkton for a long time because of it's stylish interior design but our room was the bland and standard hotel set up. I had trouble sleeping thanks to noisy neighbours and the bar downstairs. The only good thing about the hotel is the air-conditioning which kept our room nice and chilled. All in all I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, there are much nicer placers around Sydney similarly priced.

Reviews.Title: “The biggest scam in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ChristianMoss
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kirketon for three nights in February and it was a big mistake. It disappoints me greatly that hotels can oversell themselves and underdeliver so much. The hotel's claim: a hip, design/boutique hotel in a good location between Darlinghurst and Kings Cross The reality: a run down, lackluster property that I would not stay at again - but in a good location between Darlinghurst and Kings Cross First, the pros: 1. Location - great for both shopping and partying. 2. Decent enough service at front desk. Then, the cons: 1. No lift. 2. The corridors and the room are so dark you can hardly see your hand. In fact the shower is so dark you cannot read the labels on the amenities. 3. AUS$15 per day for internet is a rip off. 4. The Executive Room, which was far from executive, did not look anything like the pictures on the hotel website. The room standard is no more than a 2* hotel: dirty carpet, poor furniture, uncomfortable mattress, not cozy, chipped paint.. In addition there was only one socket in the room (in addition to one in the bathroom). 5. The doors/walls are thin so you are likely to be woken up by other guests and hotel housekeeping staff.

Reviews.Title: “The staff are the best thing about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: thegirl5
Reviews.Content: I was having a one night getaway from my toddler and with another baby on the way was hoping for a quiet night's sleep but not expecting it due to the reviews here. Before I stayed I sent an e-mail to the hotel asking that if at all possible, I be allocated a quiet room. I got an e-mail straight back saying that had been arranged. I arrived to find that I had also been upgraded from an executive to a superior room. Despite facing onto the street, I found that the room was incredibly quiet and I had a fantastic night's sleep. Given the standard of the superior room, I'm not that surprised that people are disappointed with the smaller rooms as it really wasn't very big and the bathroom was looking quiet tired (e.g. chips in the ceramic in the sink). Each of the staff members that were on the front desk when I checked in and out were absolutely fantastic. They were both increcibly lovely and helpful and pointed me the direction of great dinner and breakfast options nearby. I can't praise the staff enough. My only hiccup was with carparking. I had booked this in advance and discussed it with the kirketon staff but when I got to the Diamant hotel they had no record of the booking and seemed a bit put out by it (but eventually sorted it out).

Reviews.Title: “Good location and decent price”
Reviews.Author: kenbpfell
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at end of Aus tour. Rooms are small but nicely decorated and a good shower. When booking ask for room at front in 1st floor or upper floors. Disco at weekends is loud until 2 am. We were st front on 1st floor and did not hear a thing - others complained. It is 5 minutes walk from Kings Cross station and bus routes into city centre Restaurant is run for a separate business. Only ate there once - lots of choice in Kings Cross - tapas were superb. Very imaginative cocktails - lots with passion fruit at average prices. The various receptionists were all incredibly helpful with travel advice, places to eat. Now for the negatives. In a country renowned for its beer (and I don't mean VB) and wine the bar/restaurant only has Mexican, Japanese and Italian beer (all the mass market rubbish) and has only 3 Aus wines in a long wine list. Terrible. The bed gave me an aching back - but mirror headboard made up for it

Reviews.Title: “Great location - poor bed quality, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: lutenk
Reviews.Content: Great location - and it seems the hotel counts on this alone for visitors. My "double" bed was really two single mattresses stuck together, which is nothing short of comical and pathetic, as you simply cannot sleep across the horrible wedge in the middle of the bed created by the fact the already small double mattress is in fact two singled. Room amenities are are shine and no substance - only one set of electrical outlets for the whole room, and the shower features a nightmarish spot coming out of the side wall of the shower. I called down to have laundry picked up before leaving for work, only to return in the evening to find my laundry still in it's bag unwashed. This is a great hotel location if you are in town and want a spot to crash after a drunk night out - but if you want a comfortable bed and any level of real hotel service, this is not the place to stay. Also - the hotel has zero provision for parking. Do not attempt to bring a car here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Sydney and good location, but don't bring the car!”
Reviews.Author: Sabinaut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kirketon Boutique Hotel for 3 nights for my husband's birthday. The hotel is in a great location, with plenty of bars and restaurants nearby. An excellent sourdough bakery just across the road is perfect for a cheap breakfast. Inside it is very atmospheric, dark and elegant. However this asthetic spreads to the rooms which are definitely on the small side - to see our tv we had to lie on the bed and look up. And the dark interiors only help to make the space seem much smaller. A little lightening up wouldn't hurt. We had read on other reviews that it could be a bit noisy so we requested a room at the back of the hotel, which was quiet from street noise, but the walls are like paper and we could easily hear conversations in the next room. On arrival I went in to ask where we could park. The receptionist said there was a car wash across the road that would park our car for $35 a day and that was the only option. I already knew when we booked the Kirketon didn't have a car park, but $35 a day to park at a car wash? I thought they would have at least sorted out a deal with a nearby car park for guests. At the extra cost I could have booked a better hotel with a car park. Overall though, for what we paid it is a nice enough hotel. The location was a big plus for us being a short walk to the station or a 15 minute walk to the city. Would stay there again, if next time we don't bring the car

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Hotel, cheap refit, can't hide the cracks”
Reviews.Author: Firefly51
Reviews.Content: We checked in, had a shower and checked straight out because that is how bad the hotel was!!! Only had a shower because we had just been travelling for over 24hrs and were desperate. We got no refund but wrote the money off, there was no way we were going to sleep there!!! The hotel is in a grotty area, I was horrified as the taxi pulled up and did not feel the least bit safe. I had emailed the hotel before we left the UK, to tell them that we would not be arriving until the 14th as our flight landed at 6am but had paid for the 13th so that we could check in early. When we arrived our reservation card had a great big NO SHOW scrawled across it. So no one had paid any attention to my email despite the fact they did reply. We paid for a premium room but you could still only just walk around the bed. The window was frosted and coved with dead bug splodges on the outside, YUCK! Chipped paint everywhere. The bathroom had pubic hair on the floor. They have just tried to paint a very tired looking hotel, a new shower curtain, a flat screen tv and some big mirrors. It doesn't make a cheap hotel look or feel expensive. Any room that makes you not want to touch anything for fear of dirt, should not be stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Looks good in the pics - old and worn out in real life”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne_Female
Reviews.Content: If you want to visit the sights of Darlinghurst, the Kirketon is well located. I stayed in one of these properties in San Francisco and loved it. Unfortunately, the Kirketon in Sydney is nothing like it's overseas relation. The inside is trendy and dark with deep red carpets and black walls. Arriving in my room, I noticed the dim lighting was a ploy to disguise furniture that was old and worn. Big chunks were missing from the armchair and the bedside tables were chipped and stained. The walls weren't in much better shape. My room was apparently a 'superior' room, the best category in the house. All I can say is that if this is the best, I dread to imagine what the other rooms were like! Arriving back at the hotel at 10pm on a Saturday night I was glad I'd requested a quiet room. There was a full-on rave style party happening downstairs!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Gandaratravels
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel is wonderful. Everyone at the front desk is thoughtful, helpful, and seemingly always cheerful. The cleaning staff is skilled and considerateâ€”they worked around my changing schedule and various towel needs (one for the gym, one for yoga, one for the beach). The included access to Fitness First Kings Cross is a great benefit. The gym is very well run and equipped with anything you could want from kettle bells to personal trainers. There are a number of great yoga studios within walking distance including a wonderful Bikram studio. Even if you don't want to stay fit while staying in Sydney, the Kirketon's location is fantastic. It's within walking distance to the wonderful parts of Potts Point and Surry Hills, so there are many very good cafes and restaurants to choose from. For night life, you won't need a cab since Kings Cross and Oxford street are both so close. The CBD, botanical gardens and Sydney Opera house are all a pleasant 15-25 minute walk away or a very quick, inexpensive cab. The 380 bus to Bondi beach is very close so getting to Bondi junction or tamarama is easy. If you're familiar with Sydney, you'll understand what a great location this is, and if not you'll have the very helpful staff here to help point you in the right direction. Wifi in the room was very cheap and reliable. No sign of any cockroaches or waterbugs--and they're very common in Sydney. I've stayed at this hotel a number of times, the first when it originally opened. I loved it's Wallpaper magazine, minimalist aesthetic (and aesop products) then, but it's more affordable now and they've kept up all the important points (very nice bed with down pillows, A/C, wifi, very clean...even their products smell nice and plant based/refreshing). The Kirketon has elements of a hostel as well as of a four seasons or the One Aldwychâ€”and I like the choices they've made. If you're looking for the same great location and wonderful service, but larger more luxurious rooms, consider the Medusa just up the street. It's fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - dingy rooms”
Reviews.Author: misspingu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Kirketon because we booked fairly late for a stay in Sydney over NYE 2009, and all the other hotels seemed to either be booked up or have hiked their rates to preposterous levels. It's located on the more salubrious end of Darlinghurst Road, and there are lots of nice cafes around for brunch, and easy access (2 min walk) to Kings Cross station to get into the CBD or the train down to Bondi Junction. Our room was tiny, and overlooked a wall so was also pretty dingy. We were out and about sightseeing so it didn't matter much but we woudn't have wanted to do much more than sleep in there. It had some nice touches, lovely smelling shampoo etc and a big flatscreen tv, but ultimately it was just a well located, functional hotel room. If you're looking to stay in Sydney near all the attractions but in an area with a little more atmosphere than the CBD, and just want a crashpad, I would recommend the Kirketon, but it did seem a little pricy for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “Very Glam and Swish... But...”
Reviews.Author: Miapeders83
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business as I usually stay in their sister Hotel Diamant up the street in Potts Point. This hotel looks very swish and glam, yet when you look down a bit further, it felt like a place men take their $100 hour girls to.... just the vibe I got from the hotel.... There was no parking yet across the street there is a car wash who extort money out of you for parking, so I played roulette and parked on the street and never got a ticket, yet that was pure luck! The staff were gorgeous and friendly, and the location is good if you don't have a car. The hotel was a bit shabby, and lugging your luggage up the stairs was trying after lugging it all the way up the street if you couldn't get a car park. I would recommend this hotel, yet if you have $50 extra dollars I would stay at Hotel Diamant, just more classy, newer feeling and cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sant
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Sydney; thus, my third stay at this hotel. Although I do enjoy this hotel, it may not be for everyone. Three reasons I keep returning: location to train station and restaurants; friendly hotel staff; and Le Petit Creme cafe across the street. This hotel is about a 5-10 minute walk to the train station, many restaurants, pharmacies and a Coles supermarket. Depending on the route taken, the 5-10 walk to the station may take you into the Red Light District. Compared to other chains, I consider the Kirketon a no-frills hotel. The on-site restaurant isn't open all day and room service appears not to be 24 hours. Frills which some may require. The hotel also has no lift, so travel lighlty. When I first stayed here six years ago, I was surprised there was none. Fortunately, the hotel staff assisted to help me carry the luggage up the stairs. On my subsequent stays, I decided to carry the luggage myself. On stays when I had a later flight, I had no problems leaving my luggage with the staff after check-out. I have stayed in both the Standard and Premium rooms which have a small walk-in closet. The closet only has a few shelves with the coffee pot taking up space in one of them. You may end up living out of the suitcase during your stay. I didn't mind as it helped me pack quicker on my final nights. Fortunately, they have made a major safety improvement to the rooms since my prior stay four years ago. At that time, there was a nightstand with metal edges at the same height as the nearby bed. It was very easy to rollover right and hit your head on the metal corner. There is now plenty of space between the bed and nightstand to prevent a similar accident. The bar near the back of the hotel is trendy and popular with the locals. Fortunately, the noise is limited to the reception area, so I never heard any noises in my room. There were a few occasions when I heard people shouting and laughing in the middle of the night in the lobby outside my room. As expected, housecleaning did a good job of cleaning my room each day. Interesting that two of the larger towels were always left on the bed while the rest were hung in the bathroom. Near the end of my stay, I was surprised to find a stack of clean sheets on my chair. I can only assume the person got distracted and forgot they were left there. Since the sheets were not a distraction, I kept forgetting to bring them down to the front desk. During my last stay, I had laundered a long-sleeved t-shirt and travel pants which I wore on the plane. I was surprised that neither came back clean. Since the food stains were removed when they were washed back home, the laundromat must have used a weaker detergent. Next time, I will save the $20 AUS and just wash them when I get home.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Kheakat
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff, beautiful hotel. The rooms were smaller yes, but the fact that the staff were friendly, very helpful, and available 24 hours, made the stay more than worth it. If you are looking for a stylish hotel, close to public transport, and the main attractions, then you cant go wrong. My partner and I will return next time we are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressive”
Reviews.Author: Astrobop
Reviews.Content: This markets itself as a â€œboutiqueâ€� hotel but it falls short of the mark on many of the basics. My â€œexecutiveâ€� room was minimalist and was in need of a refurb with stains on the carpet, no draw space, a bathroom that was just a tight side corridor and waist level lighting in the shower cubicle that was useless. Actually the whole room was very poorly lit. Similarly the sound insulation from the room above and bar below was inadequate. Housekeeping was similarly below standard. Room never looked particularly clean and whatâ€™s the point of giving you coffee making facilities if they donâ€™t give you coffee. What it has going for it is the fact that itâ€™s a short walk from the bars and clubs of both Oxford St & Kings Cross and 5 minutes away from Kings Cross train station (which also means itâ€™s surrounded by backpackers hostels). If youâ€™re planning to stay one night I am sure this hotel is fine but I would not recommend it for longer stays

Reviews.Title: “I went to shop!! Great hotel in ideal location for all that Sydney has to offer..!”
Reviews.Author: KazNewZealand
Reviews.Content: 4 days to shop and so little time, the 24hour reception was so helpful pointing me in all the right directions. A short 2 minute walk to the train station, and taxis outside the front door, a 10 minute walk to Oxford Street & Paddington for clothes, 2 train stops from Bondi Junction Mall for everything else!! Handy walk to cafes & restaurants..Room service was prompt and great food, the room itself had plenty of space for me and was very quiet at night. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster in Darlinghurst!”
Reviews.Author: LisaSMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotels that I have ever stayed in! It was more like a nightclub than a hotel, there is a bar downstairs and the music is blaring until 2am. Once the music is finally turned off you can hear all the rowdy people walking back to their rooms, the walls are paper thin! The bed was small & hard, it was two single beds pushed together. Also there is no lift so you need to carry your suitcase upstairs! The one positive was the staff were friendly & tried to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: brendonaustin
Reviews.Content: First time I stayed in this Hotel.Great location in Darlinghurst but thats where it ends.No room avail on check in , smallest room I have ever seen in Sydney,no lighting , dark room,hard bed that was actually 2 single beds pushed together that slid apart through the night,moldy tiles in shower and cockroaches.Housecleaning made the bed but left the dirty plate and glasses and rubbish behind for when I arrived back that next night.Really was the worst experience I have ever had at a Hotel in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute bar”
Reviews.Author: ilove2travel81
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel in a great location. Nice if you plan staying up late on the weekends. There is a gorgeous little cocktail bar there which was pretty loud when we were trying to sleep on the Friday night til about 1am - But we had some great cocktails there on the Saturday night. Wouldn't stay there again on the weekend due to the noise, but would return to the bar!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place a little out of town”
Reviews.Author: jkc76
Reviews.Content: I go to Sydney often, and I stay in one of two hotels - and one is the Kirketon. I like the location of Kirketon, which is walking distance to Paddington and to the city. There are a number of quaint cafes around there too, so there is always somewhere to go for something to eat. The standard rooms are pretty small, and quite close to the door, so you can hear people walking up and down the hallway if you're a light sleeper. If you have a lot of luggage with you, just beware there are no elevators, so if your room is upstairs, you will have to drag your bags up the stairs. For the price, it is a fantastic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Naustrav
Reviews.Content: The Kirketon is a well-priced hotel in a brilliant Darlinghurst location. The standard room is small - not designed for lounging around in - but has all you need for a comfortable stay. The main selling point, for me, is that it's out of the city, but in easy walking distance. For those times when walking is not an option (late at night, longer journeys, non-walking shoes) it's easy to grab a cab as they go flying by the door regularly. It's really the best of both worlds.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in great location”
Reviews.Author: jlo9907
Reviews.Content: If you are after a place with a great location (within walking distance to trains to the Centre of town and buses to Bondi) and near some very tasty resturants then this is surely worth a look. You can walk to the centre of town (via William Street) if you like. The small cafe across the road does the best breakfast and coffee and other yummy french delights. The staff were very friendly and knowledgable. The room admittedly was small but comfy with a comfortable bed and a great tv. The bathroom was tidy and clean with great Roma toiletries. Overall I would certainly stay there again. A great place to explore a bit more of the real Sydney ....

Reviews.Title: “A cool little hotel that's quiet and cosy”
Reviews.Author: KtJPM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kirketon for business. It has a really cool ambience with it's long mirrored hallway and quiet dimly lit cosiness. The rooms are small but stylish and clean; which is basically all I want from a hotel when I'm away from home. The in room dining I had one night was very good. It feels safe and quiet. I met a few colleagues in the cocktail bar downstairs which is nice and cosy and definitely quite cool. It was nice to be able to stay somewhere close to the city , but in a cool end of town.

Reviews.Title: “KEEP IT A SECRET”
Reviews.Author: nomis_mikah
Reviews.Content: I travel a bit for work. And the most annoying thing when travelling to a new destination is trying to work out which accommodation you want to book in. Most websites will show the best rooms and the best picutres of the room...making them always look so much better than they are...and when you get there, well you get disappointed. Feel somewhat ripped off. The Kirkton is not one of those places. It's a well-designed simple boutique in a great location. A place that is comfortable and not over-the-top. The beds are great, the rooms are unique and the staff are fabulous. There's a great bar and restaurant on the ground floor if you feel a bit peckish or just want to grab a drink. The only problem now is as it gets more popular it is hard to get in so I suggest booking well in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location but clean and small rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravellingRainbow
Reviews.Content: Title says it all, great central location, fantastic amenities around darlinghurst road but seriously tiny (and dark) rooms with a TV on the wall so high that you get a bit of a screwed up neck. But if your not watching TV and not requiring a lot of time in your room the price = Value !!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor experience overall”
Reviews.Author: Lance1202
Reviews.Content: A group of colleagues and I stayed there over a couple weeks. Overall, the expereince was quite substandard. The staff at the desk were courteous enough, but from there on it was quite negative. Beneath the contemporary hip metropolitan facade lies a list of reasons why this hotel is not recommended. Firstly, there are cockroaches everywhere! They were particularly bad in the showers. The carpets (despite requests from all of us who stayed), were never vacuumed once. We even asked to do it ourselves. Perhaps they don't own a sweeper. The bed linen was changed maybe twice (if that) in two weeks. My room in particular was missed completely on daily cleans on two occasions. Most of the time it meant just mkaing the bed and changing towels if you were lucky.

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: OK99
Reviews.Content: I was quite impressed by the Kirketon when I arrived. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms were nice if smallish and dark. However, that all changed when I tried to spend the night here. A new restaurant has just openend in the hotel and the room I was given was directly above the bar. The noise belts out until the early hours and even with ear plugs there's no way you can sleep. Having put up with it for a night or two I've just contacted reception and been told by them that the music will be going on until 1.30am tonight as it's a Saturday. As I have to get up at 6am to catch a flight I'm not very impressed. The hotel seems to be focusing on bringing in customers to it's restuarant and bar at the expenses of its staying guests. It has lots of good things about it but you tend not to appreciate them if you're trying to survive on 4/5 hours sleep. By all means come here for a meal and a drink, but not to stay the night.

Reviews.Title: “Poor experience”
Reviews.Author: dgold105
Reviews.Content: When I booked I anticipated the rooms might be small so I went with a room 3 categories higher than the cheapest as it was bigger. The size of the room was OK. The air conditioner in the room didn't work and the room was very stuffy. The room constantly vibrated from the footsteps from the room above me. Every time they moved I would hear or feel it. This went on much of the night. I was also right next to the stairs and heard every movement on the stairwell. One of the worst nights sleep I've had in a long time. Was exhausted for all my business meetings the next day. The room was also a bit run down. I certainly wouldn't call it anything close to 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Toluana
Reviews.Content: I was chaperoning the 16yr old daughter of a friend who was in nearby St Vincents Hospital, and we both were pretty happy with the Kirketon. It's central position is brilliant. I had to park my car at the nearby Diamont Hotel, which was no problem. The Executive Room was a decent enough size, with a roll out bed for the 16yr old. She was happy with the softer roll out, and I found the firmer main bed incredibly comfortable. TV is excellent. Was happy I was able to open the windows, despite the sign requesting not to (can't stand non opening windows). Bathroom was clean - and while I appreciate the theatrics of the dimly lit bathroom, would like management to note that most females would prefer a little more light on the mirror! I think the shower cubicle was clean, but couldn't really tell because of the darkness of the cubicle - again though, the theatrics of the lighting halfway down the wall is kind of ok in a strange way. The room was light and clean and comfortable. There are some things that need fixing - the wall mounted bedside lights need to be tightened back onto the wall - this could be a safety issue if not dealt with...and the towel peg in the bathroom needs the same sort of fixing. Little details that are very noticeable. Decor is tasteful in the room - which I always appreciate. We didn't use the tea/coffee/fridge - so can't comment on that - but the plethora of nearby cafes is brilliant....I can't recommend highly enough the very plain and tiny Kings Cafe on the same side of the road towards Kings Cross. The freshest tastiest and cheapest homefood meals and breakfasts you'll find in this area of the city...or anywhere. The staff, including the cleaning staff, are helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service -- beautiful/convenient spot!”
Reviews.Author: trlbdee
Reviews.Content: This little boutique hotel is great for a weekend getaway with a boy/girlfriend. It's very sexy. From the staff to the dimly lit rooms, romance is abundant. If you happen to stay while Ingo and Sahara are working, be rest assured they will take the best care of you! We also loved the location. As walkers, the locale was very convenient to get to the most touristy of spots and to off the beaten path types of neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: aero111
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Kirketon several times during the last 5 years and were sorely disappointed this time. The rooms are small but that is not a problem. The bedroom itself is quite well presented but the chair in the corner was pretty battered and the finishes have seen better days. Again, I can deal. However, the bathroom was utterly foul. The fixtures are fine but the dark tiles are vile and very poorly maintained. There were hairs on the floor, in the shower and mould and soap scum everywhere. We are never staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good hotel but could be better!”
Reviews.Author: stephoid
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable and in a great location, but the housekeeping was less than perfect (rubbish left in the room or sometimes nothing done at all) and the random people drinking in the bar (somewhere in the hotel) were an unnecessary addition. It also really should include breakfast, but doesn't.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, GOOD LOCATION, A FEW ODDITIES, BUT WOULD STAY AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: oggybags
Reviews.Content: stayed here 4 nights at end of 3 week trip in oz with husband - we're a couple around 30ish! Booked in advance via uk expedia and got a good rate in sterling Â£ which given poor exchange rate made it seem all the better All in all a good hotel which I would recommend to friends and stay here again Standard room, good size as walk in wardrobe so loads of space to dump bags Good size TV, dvd player etc - no remote for that tho...seemed to be missing - the desk assistant was very helpful but could not resolve the issue. a few quirks - the wondow has frosting on it so you cant see the non-view, which made it seem a little dark - but the whole hotel is 'trendy dark', the coffee wasnt replaced dialy and the shampoo etc was replaced when finished rather than daily and light in shower didnt work which made for a v dark shower - did report it but not fixed, and it is in a busy area of sydney and is not a quiet hotel so not best for families. No resterant at the moment, but v trendy bar hidden away at back - all quiet odd! Eat breakfast at petit creme accross the road - genuine french place, v quick, fresh and reasonable Hotel recommended, and we very much enjoyed a posher meal at an amazing italian nearby called atavola - go and try it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - EXCELLENT staff - Very good value”
Reviews.Author: BostonRV
Reviews.Content: Intimate boutique-style hotel located a few blocks from Kings Cross train station. Great cafes and restaurants just a block away, on Victoria Street. Short walking distance to Oxford Street and beautiful Surry Hills. I had a couple of very minor issues with my room and the staff immediately jumped into action. The front desk manager, Alex, does a GREAT job ensuring guests are happy and comfortable. He's super friendly and a genuine nice guy. The entire front desk staff and housekeeping crew also are great at their jobs. The hotel has a relaxed ambiance, with low-level lighting. This might not appeal to all demographics, but it provides a calm environment while away from home. Free entry to the local Fitness First, a full-service health club, is a valuable perk.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel - would not return”
Reviews.Author: localgal38
Reviews.Content: Maybe we were a little unsure as to what the word 'Boutique' means when associated with a Hotel? If it means extremely low level lighting, very small, dark rooms, and not terribly welcoming, then I guess that this hotel fits the bill!! After staying at another hotel in this chain in Melbourne, The Cosmopolitan, which I have also reviewed, we were quite disappointed. We arrived after a very long and tiring train journey from Melbourne, and the last thing we needed to find was long dark hairs from some previous occupant on the bathroom floor and a lively cockroach! Also no lift, so heavy luggage had to be carried. As mentioned, lighting throughout the hotel is poor in the extreme, even in the common areas, making stairs a bit of a hazard, and reading at night impossible. The 32 inch tv is a nice touch, but hangs from the ceiling at the end of the bed, meaning that anyone taller than 5ft 7 risks a head injury en route to the bathroom. Walls are quite thin, and, being on the 1st floor we could also hear the people walking about in the room above, and tripping up the poorly lit stairs, which were right by our room! Its not all bad, however....staff are friendly and helpful, the area is good for eating out (the hotel has a restaurant but it appears to be closed and up for lease!!), and the hotel is within walking distance (about half an hour) of the main attractions (Opera House, Harbour) . Also I love the mirror on the wall which is black glass, like a 2 way mirror..totally useless but quirky!! I want to take it home!! We stayed 3 nights and that was enough.

Reviews.Title: “Staff make this a great stay”
Reviews.Author: scottybail
Reviews.Content: but there are lots of design flaws for a 'design hotel'. Chief among these is the lack of a lift or even a ramp at the front door. Following close on is the decidedly dodgy beds many (but not all) of which are of Heath Robinson design quality. However, the staff more than compensate. Most people can cope with the beds but if you can't, they'll move you to another room quick sticks. The ladies and gents who clean the rooms are very thorough and it has to be remembered that at 120 aud per night, its quite cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual, modern, trendy appearance”
Reviews.Author: ERRN95
Reviews.Content: I was booked into the Kirketon by my employer for one night. After a long flight from LAX, I trained in from the airport and walked the couple miles to the hotel, figuring I could use the exercise. Thinking I would walk right to it, I over shot it due to poor signage, after a long walk, decided to break out the address and found that I had walked right by45 minutes before. They told me the room would be ready in 30 minutes, so I left my bag and wandered the neighborhood which is the King's Cross/ Darlinghurst area, which has lots of places to eat/drink/and spend. When Ireturned in an hour, I was told it would be five more minutes, I went to the 3rd floor looking for room 313 which turned out to be on the second floor. The room as well as the whole hotel was a older building redone to be modern like, My room was nice, clean, had a bathroom 3 ft wide and 12 ft long, with a shower to the side,,,,,,,,didn't find the servibar or the other goodies hidden in the closet until the next day, Was an OK place, I usually don't spend a lot on hotels, going for a two star in europe, There was a bar downstairs, but didn't appear to be open at any time, also a restaurant space that apparently was for lease. All in all a kind of weird quirky hotel,, I would not have a problem staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect alternative to all the "recognized" name brands!”
Reviews.Author: boystownboys
Reviews.Content: After several weeks of searching for a reasonably priced room, we happened onto the Kirketon and booked it immediately for the great rate. We spent 10 nights at the Kirketon in late November with another friend and thoroughly enjoyed our stay! The rooms were sheik and stylish had a nice closet and space to spread out and enjoy our stay. The in-room safe was perfect to store our laptop and other valuables in while we were out and about each day. The hotel location was a great central location, just a few steps to the Kings Cross nightlife and a quick walk to the Oxford Street bars as well. The staff was accommodating and helpful with any requests or questions we had. The free access to the gym (which is just down the street and a full service gym) was great and nice to be able to work out on our longer stay. The only thing we could think of, was that our room could have been vacuumed a little more often during the stay. With darker carpet in the rooms, it show lint and such and while certainly not every day, a few more times would have been nice. As we were going to the gym most days and also showering more than once a day with the heat and all the walking we did touring we requested towels from the front desk several times. Most days, they had them available at the front office, however several days, they had to go looking in the housekeeping closets. Not a big deal to us, but would have been nice for the staff if they didn't have to go running floor to floor to get us towels. Overall a delightful stay, the internet worked great, and we would definitely stay again and recommend to others. On behalf of the Kirketon, to all those who complain about the small rooms/hotel, it's a boutique hotel, it's meant to be quaint, and simple. For the money, the Kirketon was a steal for the nice rooms and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, decor is great/ok, horrible house cleaning”
Reviews.Author: artrun02
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 nights. Arrived and the staff was very nice and friendly. Although some could use training on tips, how to get around city, where to go. I think staff should be trained in basic stuff like transportation, cost, offering advice, etc and some where not up to par, but very friendly. Decor was kinda cool, the room was small, but that was totally fine and expected. However, the lighting is not great, theres a bad step to go into bathroom that I stumbled on a few times. House cleaning: awful job, lazy, rude. All they did was "do our bed." Vaccuming and cleaning the bathroom and wiping down MIRROR headboard would have been nice. Very sloppy job and they were not nice or friendly. I think they all need to be replaced. We asked for a couple things to get done, since they were not doing them and they only did it one day. Our side lamp went out and after asking 3 times and 3 days later, WE had to take care of it ourselves! That's not ok. Even after a good stay, nice staff, affordable prices for a boutique hotel, I prob wouldnt go back or recommend because of the awful house cleaning. You pay for a place to stay, nice bed, good/friendly/knowledgeable staff, clean place, in a central neighborhood. They got 3 right, 1 ok, and 1 awful.

Reviews.Title: “hmmmm”
Reviews.Author: bagg10
Reviews.Content: mixed feelings about this place. seems a decent hotel on the face of it but a few things let it down. first of all, the rooms and bathrooms are tiny with poorly appointed plug sockets (the kettle had a very short cord and we had to put it on a poof as it wouldn't reach the table). second, although the shower is a decent size, with a good size head, it's very dark with the shower curtain shut - daft rather than romantic, or trendy. third, room service wasn't great either - on new years eve, admittedly we didn't leave our room until about midday, the room was not made up. they seemed a bit lax at replenishing tea, coffee and milk too. liked the location as there are plenty of places to eat in the vicinity. king's cafe, down the road, does an excellent value breakfast and you should also check out the schnitzels at una's on the adjacent street. one other observation. i noticed that the 'italian' menu on room service was identical to one of the restaurants we'd eaten in, and we noticed staff going away to deliver stuff. they did pizzas in three sizes but the hotel only offered one (the cynic in me expects it would be the smallest!)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic service, immaculate rooms, trendy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Roxy60CoffsHarbour
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated in the party capital of Sydney, ideal for a short stay or even a week - this beautiful boutique hotel captures modern style, old hollywood charm and the comfort of a professional establishment - all in one. I stayed at the Kirketon Hotel for the first time a few weeks ago and will definitely come again! I was pleasantly suprised at how well we were looked after. The staff were helpful, friendly and charismatic, the rooms were ideally appointed with modern furnishings, it was quiet enough to sleep but in the best location to step out and party. One of the most comfortable beds I have slept in! and the shower is very modern - the water doesn't splash all over the bathroom like most 'boring' hotel room showers - the shower alone is funky! Highly recommended for all types of travellers - especially the type who like to have a bit of that 'extra' added in when booking their accommodation. Ten stars from me!

Reviews.Title: “Champagne taste on a beer budget”
Reviews.Author: Kane1978
Reviews.Content: In terms of value for money this boutique hotel can't be beaten. Its certainly not 5 star or roomy, but with rooms starting as little as $120 per night, its the perfect overnight hotel. I stay there when ever Im in sydney for work. the rooms are very small but fitted out well with stylish interiors that probably aren't everyone's cup of tea. The hotel has quiet a 'dark' feel and has a lot of character which is what i love about it. Its perfect if you're on a budget but like the 'designer' experience without the price tag. It is perfect for business trips as it is compact, lots of great cafes on your doorstep like tripicana for a quick meal after work. Close to Fitness First darlinghurst for a gym workout and the staff are fantastic. I haven't stayed there outside of business trips and would be hesitant as it is a little small and doesn't have that holiday feel. It is what it is - and it's the prefect accommodation for my needs on business trips.

Reviews.Title: “service rules”
Reviews.Author: chooMelbourne
Reviews.Content: its the service that impressed me. stayed for 5 nights nd by the ennd reallyfelt like coming home each night and didnt want to leave. its a very cool hotel. well priced rooms are a little small but all in all its highly reccommended

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary, noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: simone_dahl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the thick of the nightclub scene in kings cross, people seemed to be bringing their parties back to the rooms and the walls were very thin as we could hear everything. Also, no curtain over the window meant we couldn't sleep in for the light getting in. Definitely more of a 3 star level hotel - the photos on the website make it look better than it is.

Reviews.Title: “Cool,trendy place”
Reviews.Author: ziggyzee
Reviews.Content: Nice frontage to the hotel,and the whole stay was great. Really helpful nice staff,nice room-comfy bed,great plasma TV,nice bathroom with a big bath,good fridge,linen,cleanliness and nice and quiet. Great value,this place is worthy of 4 stars,its a pleasure to stay at. A hidden gen in a great part of sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed. Perfect if you have champange taste and only a beer budget.”
Reviews.Author: lincatski
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Kirketon early, tired and in desperate need of a shower before a busy day of meetings. The friendly staff turned my room around in twenty minutes whilst I had a coffee. They followed up on this impressive service by printing documents for me, booking cabs and giving me tips and pointers about where to find things. Sure - the room was small but it was perfectly formed and very clean. It had everything I needed including TV and access to wireless. Best of all, the hotel was a short walk to the CBD, Paddington, Potts Point and Kings Cross. Kings Cross station is just 2 minutes away. I was here for business but could easily come back to holiday with so many lovely cafe's and bars a stones throw away. I am surprised by the other reviews on this site. It feels like I stayed at a very different hotel. Perhaps there has been a change in staff or management and if that is the case it's improved a lot. I only have this one stay to go by and I was very happy with the service at the price. This is a great place to rest your head if you are after no frills accommodation that is a little hipper than your average budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very oridinary - there are better options ...”
Reviews.Author: dsg73
Reviews.Content: BEWARE SELF RATED HOTELS. If someone independant was rating the Kirketon it would be 3 stars at best. Yes, the rooms are small but that's OK. It was the cleanlinss of the room that shocked me. FILTHY. There were pubic hairs and boogers in the sink from the previous occupant, the bathroom floor looked like it hadn't even been introduced to a mop, the shower was mouldy, and the carpet hadn't seen a vaccuum either. Other reviewers have already posted photo's of the flaking and peeling paint - it hasn't been fixed. This place has great potential, but is let down by a lack of attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “rooms very small, road traffice noise and to expensive”
Reviews.Author: johnjerrabomberra
Reviews.Content: if your thinking of staying at this hotel, DONT! traffic noise and rooms are to small we will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated - definitely not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Luke_48
Reviews.Content: No room service. No concierge. Well, no service at all for that matter. The room was dark and cramped, some genius decided to place the light in the shower at crotch level where it is of no use to anyone. The air conditioner remote needed new batteries to make it work. To its credit, it is in a good location to find reasonable places to eat, so while not having an on site restaurant and bar open was disappointing, it wasnâ€™t a show stopper. As for the 5 star self rating, they must think theyâ€™re comedians! Three stars would be more accurate. Too expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: justcruizen
Reviews.Content: On wotif.com these guys self rate at 5 star. Well if that's the case then Iâ€™m George Clooney. Realistically this would be 3 star at best. No room service, No Concierge, No Restaurant or Bar, not even Do Not Disturb cards. The rooms are dark and small, if you are on the 2nd floor you have to haul your luggage up the stairs on your own and there is only ONE STAFF for the entire hotel. If you like this part of town try the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: bubbaParis
