Reviews.Content: this hotel is very cool, the front staff are really welcoming and knowledgable about the local area and the decor is very hip but also very comfortable.they went out of their way to make us feel special...but the best part is the price. we booked the hotel directly over their website and paid $AU149 which was amazing value. we will be coming back soon and happy to tell our friends about this little gem of a hotel

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: Stef15
Reviews.Content: Chose Kirketon b/c of its cool looking website. The hotel is really just a bunch rooms in the same building... service is really poor - just one person at the front desk who can't handle it all. Rooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “form without function”
Reviews.Author: reddeluxe
Reviews.Content: While there were some nice style choices, overall the design of this hotel was poorly thought-out and not at all comfortable. We, as a treat, went for a premium room. It was so small, we went downstairs to check that this WAS actually a premium and not a standard. Here is a brief list of disappointing features: - luckily we only brought one small suitcase. Even so, we had to shove it in the closet so that we could move remotely comfortably around the room. - there was absolutely no comfortable position from which to watch television. - there was no safe place to put a hairdryer near a mirror. - there was nowhere wide enough to put bathroom equipment, so we had to clutter the floor. - the towels were very poor quality and way too small. A design hotel is supposed to be a touch of luxury, not getting something that reminded us of someone's skanky spare towel when they've run out of everything else. - the lights in the stairwell were not quite dark enough to hide the condition of the carpet, not quite bright enough to avoid our risking breaking our necks. - there was no thought given to brightening up the dismal view from our window. - and finally, whose bright idea was it to have the only light in the shower directed at crotch level??? We were very disappointed- a decidedly average destination.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: moomoo3001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a special birthday getaway. I thought this would be an interesting place to stay as it was in a different part of sydney than we usually stay. The hotel has a cool chic feel with hallways and entryway very artistic. However our troubles started before we even arrived as there is NO WHERE to park before checking in even though we had asked about this when confirming the booking. Single travellers would have a lot of trouble finding a park in the tiny streets surrounding streets. Our room was VERY small, quite dark, and views were of another building. The bed was actually 2 single beds pushed together and slanted so we rolled into the middle where there was an uncomfortable ridge. NOT romantic. The hallway outside was very noisy, floorboards creaked and voices echoed. The heater would not turn off no matter what we did, it was also very noisy. The location was good, it was a short walk to Kings Cross. Ignoring all the girlie bars, we found a very nice restaurant in a back street. As a boutique hotel, we were aware that facilities would be limited but we found it too limited to be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise, good location”
Reviews.Author: MRMEDERK
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay. Only drawbacks to this hotel, no elevator and small rooms. Other than that, the place is great. Would stay here again if in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, awesome staff, great room”
Reviews.Author: Catherine2410
Reviews.Content: The Kirketon is in a great location, positioned between Oxford Street and Kings Cross. It is really easy to get around on public transport. There are so many great places to eat in the local area. Don't be turned off by the preconceived notions of 'the cross' i was there for 10 days, during the week it's no worse then the valley in Brisbane, at night on the weekend it does get a little rougher but just be aware of your surroundings and your belonging and it's fine. The staff were truly fantastic. Any questions that had the answers or were prepared to find them, a big thanks in particular to Rob and Joy. The rooms are quite small, but the bathrooms are clean and the walk-in-robe is great. I was a little disappointed that there was no breakfast service, but there are many cafes that are moments away. The atmosphere at the Kirketon is great, it's funky and friendly with a great mix of sexy thrown in. I recommend a visit to the Kirketon.

Reviews.Title: “why stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: sarafirepony
Reviews.Content: This place was fabulous!!!! I had a very pleasant stay and now I have discovered it I will be back on return trips . I can't hesitate to recommend the high quality of the room for the price and in particular the staff I encountered during my stay. Nothing seemed to be a problem at all for them and they were happy to help with requests. It was refreshing to encounter such helpful and caring staff. Bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. It was quiet in the room to my surprise given the location... whch was so handy to yummy food and great coffee just a short walk away. Easy to get to shopping locations and close to the city. Parking was handy as well . I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Definately not 5 star !!”
Reviews.Author: syoban
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night as i was self rated as 5 star on last minute.com and was on special offer for one night. I stayed in a standard room which had a king size bed which took up the whole room !! The room was extremely small. There was a big wide screen television which i had to ly on the bed and look upwards at the ceiling to look at !! Not very comfortable at all. I would not recomend this hotel. The staff were nice however.

Reviews.Title: “Nice deco but House Keeping was noisy”
Reviews.Author: kobat
Reviews.Content: A unique Boutique Hotel. Don't be fooled by the photos in their website. http://www.kirketon.com.au/ The rooms are really small but cosy and elegant. Without ample lights ie DARK. Abundant use of grey and black in their deco. The house keeping is very noisy in the morning :-( as they go about their rounds. The floor boards squeaks so you can hear the occupants upstairs :) . It is just part and parcel of staying in a Hotel that is retrofitted and conserved from an old shop house. The restaurant and bar were closed due to change of ownership. Thus there were no room service etc. Don't worry, the Train Station is just across the traffic at King's Cross. Lots of small eateries around the area and convenient stores. STRICTLY NO SMOKING HOTEL. Only one person can move at a time, there are not much place around the bed. Do pardon the mess in my pic as I was running off to the airport after a quick sushi bite.

Reviews.Title: “I want to move in, PERMANENTLY!!”
Reviews.Author: MedusasPath
Reviews.Content: Truly I would if I could! I am a clean freak (at least I admit it ;-) purrfectly pristine! Rooms were absolutely fine before the reno, but now, even more diiivine :-) The brilliant Kirketon team are oh so cool, comfortably casual yet ever so very professional, such impeccable service, I want to hug them - each and every time! I honestly cannot fault this place, for me it is the perfect pad, a home away from home. The people who work there, like seeing old friends really, welcoming smiles and consistently courteous. The funtastic location, yes, FUN! I need not know no other location in Sydney - this is IT!! Well worth the $ - indeed affordable! You have it ALL staying at the "Kirk" as I fondly call it :-) Inside, and as soon as you step out. Be it shopping, Oxford St! I have even walked to town!! The best coffee is a 30 second walk!! So is the hairdresser ;-) Be it breakfast, lunch, dinner, drinks...drinks...did I mention drinks? A night out is only a short stroll away, The Kirketon Darlinghurst is the place to be!! And the place to come back to! Over and over again! I do not stay with my Sydney friends, I looove "Kirk" far TOO MUCH to want to give it up!! The lifestyle is living! Thank YOU "kirk" for making my weekends so wonderful and relaxing - I never want to leave...so that is why I keep coming back :-p

Reviews.Title: “Do not bring heavy luggages to this boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: adrah
Reviews.Content: The hotel has no elevator, so if you get the room on the 3rd floor, you have to carry your own luggages, there is only one person at the reception, no concierge, no porter nothing!! I was just there in March and they had a notice saying there was no F&B service provided, so don't expect room services. Service was ok, receptionist or the person who checked you in wasnt overly helpful, just there to do her job i guess. Also overpriced. Also rooms very dark!!

Reviews.Title: “This Place Is Great”
Reviews.Author: jimbokoz
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the kirketon . Don t listen to the complaints. This place is great. If you want a large flourescent lit room full of stick furniture covered in vinyl go to the holiday inn. The kirketon has character and style. The staff are exceedingly cordial and helpful, plus the location is IDEAL !!! JIM

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the dark ages”
Reviews.Author: Creative16
Reviews.Content: Having spent the last two days of our Australian vacation at this hotel, unfortunately, there were many other places we would have rather stayed in retrospect. Having stayed at similar boutique hotels around the world and having always enjoyed the experience, this one was not for us. From the very dark reception, to the dark staircase (which you haul your bags up because there is no lift), the dark corridors and the even darker rooms, it was all just a little too depressing. We actually made an effort to spend as little time as possible in the hotel reassuring ourselves that this would soon be over. Not a nice way to end a great first time trip to Australia. The room size was average for one person. Ventilation was a big problem as the small window (facing a wall) could not be opened, so no fresh air and no natural light. A few dim lights in the room (with black lampshades) and even the most cheerful of people could succumb to this atmosphere of gloom.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel but rooms are too small!”
Reviews.Author: cristeena
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 days and I was a bit disappointed because the bar and restaurant (which are supposed to be hip and trendy) were closed. Apart from that, I liked the hotel, but the rooms were tiny. I've been to Boutique hotels around the world and NY is supposed to have the smallest rooms, but to me the Kirketon had the smallest ones. We were in a Superior Room but still...we couldn't walk at the same time in the room. The stuff was really nice and helpful. The people saying at the hotel were young and trendy so the atmosphere was nice. This is not the place to come for a romantic gateaway. But for someone who knows Sydney already, for a few days it's good.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: AngusTrumble
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Kirketon would have been enjoyable had there not been a strong smell lurking in my second floor room that was suspiciously suggestive of the relatively recent remains of a small dead animal stuck somewhere in the airconditioning duct. Repeated inquiries, which gave way to pleas, drew no response other than (at the end of the second day) that housekeeping had "sprayed air freshener" and "everything was all right." I suppose one must take their word for it, but I am afraid the bad smell will stay with me long after I return to New Haven, Conn. What makes it doubly irritating is that the nice young man who came to fix the faulty telephone on the first evening, and to teach me how to make the air conditioner work, took one smell and uttered a sympathizing expletive, so at least I know I was not imagining it.

Reviews.Title: “Room was dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: SSdixie
Reviews.Content: I Booked into the Kirketon because of the chic decor and great location. For the most part, the stay was fine, but the room was pretty terrible. SO much so that i wouldnt stay there again. My hotel room on new york city was bigger, literally. Its clearly a converted old dorm house, and the rooms are pokey at best. Stretch your neck to watch the very sleek flatscreen. The room was very dark, faced a wall so there was little to no point opening curtains. The biggest disaster was the bathroom. Not only do the small green tiles make it look a little "minimilaist hospital" but the window was glass slats, levered like a venetian blind. It does not seal shut, and air/wind rushes in. On my first day it was 12 degrees, and the bathroom was FREEZING. Of course, the draft came into the rest of the room too. I felt like i had been conned a little - i couldnt really believe such a chic hotel didnt have windows that closed properly. Finally, got into bed (which is tiny) and as i was by myself, got settled in the middle - right on top of a thick, painful seam. The bed was actually two tiny singles (not sure the name of the size, but smaller than a single) zipped together to create a smallish queen. Between the window, the draft and the craptacular bed, I could do little but laugh at myself and decide not to stay here again, or recommend it. I think cheap details like that for a room that purports to be luxury and boutique, even if small, is a joke. You should also note, i was on the second floor, and there is no lift. Though staff do help with bags, if you dont have time to wait around for them (sometimes only one person on desk), its not the most convenient thing to drag your suitcase down two flights in high heels.

Reviews.Title: “liked the central location, very trendy hotel, we come back”
Reviews.Author: sydneyBelgium
Reviews.Content: we recommend the kirketon hotel, itÂ´s a very trendy and very good located boutique hotel. Ideal to walk to the city/harbour or to Darlinghurst/Paddington the trendy, scene districts.

Reviews.Title: “Service without a smile”
Reviews.Author: Onatop
Reviews.Content: I can't help but compare my stay at the Kirketon with a recent stay at the Medusa just a few doors down. The big difference was the service. The guys at the Medusa could not have been more helpful and seemed determined from the moment we arrived to make sure that we had everything we wanted and that we enjoyed our time in Sydney as much as possible. They went out of their way to do this. We stayed at the Kirketon last week during the Sydney Festival. Not a word of the Festival was mentioned by the people at the reception desk, which was a real surprise seeing that this is quite a major event on the Sydney festival scene. There wasn't even a copy of the Festival guide in the room nor did the Kirketon have any copies of the guide to give me when I asked for one. Having said this, the manager very kindly popped back to her house which happened to be two minutes away and came back with her copy for me. We also had trouble getting a good internet connection from our room. I had to urge the people on Reception many times before they made a concerted effort to sort the problem out (it took 3 days). At one point I was told by someone on reception, "If it doesn't work, it doesn't work." It may seem petty of me to complain about the internet connection, but when this is an advertised feature of the room and when one needs the internet for work purposes, it's fairly essential that the product is delivered. The phone in our room didn't work properly. It made a horrible screeching noise whenever we picked it up. We'd then have to unplug it and plug it back in at least two times before we would hear the dial tone. On a positive note, the room was quite nice, clean and comfortable. It was great to be able to use the well-equipped Fitness First for free. The hotel's location is its best feature. My complaints are small I am aware, but I expected more from such a reputable establishment. In my opinion, the Kirketon needs to step up the game a bit if it wants to retain it's place at the top of the Trip Advisor Sydney hotels list.

Reviews.Title: “The Kirketon is Sydney's most chic and wonderful of finds!”
Reviews.Author: jlfmusic
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the better part of 2/12 weeks of staying at The Kirketon. It's sensational! !! and was a huge part of making my stay in Sydney so alluring. Tipped off by a friend with Aussie roots, it's for those in the know! (I hesitate to even write this to give any secrets away, ha!) Chic, modern, professional and in the heart of one of the absolutely coolest areas of Sydney. Sure, for outsiders wanting to stay at a multidude of choices at the Harbor, that will be reflex choice. Great for some. But, for those wanting to feel that Sydney is home for the time they're there . . . The Kirketon is beyond perfect! Smack in Darlinghurst, with all of the cafes and cool neighborhood spots of Darlinghurst Road and Victoria Street -- from traditional "hotel" pubs to the most cutting edge of fusion cuisine and best-rated coffee shops, cafes and restaurants -- you're really in the heart. Moreover . . . every time I stepped back into The Kirketon doors and my room especially . . . I felt comfortable but cool -- hard to combine in a hotel. The decor is amazing. The rooms gorgeous, with earth tones and splashes of burgundy. The shower alone is sell enough!! with rainwater showerhead and ship portal-like spotlight on . . . you! Plus the multi-colored rugs in the foyer and clever playing of silent/B&W films simply cheeky! Add to this the chicest of restaurants and bars adjoining and . . . a young, attractive helpful staff who are there when you need them for counsel/advice but otherwise just warm and friendly . . . this was home!! for the time I was there. Working in the music industry, I've been lucky enough to travel the States and the world (South Africa, Brazil, Thailand, Europe, etc) -- from highbrow to Ian Schraeger cool -- The Kirketon is an absolute favorite on every level. Oh, I'll be back. And, please . . . only stay there if you're nice, friendly, "no worries" and worthy! lol!

Reviews.Title: “One night only..”
Reviews.Author: camstar81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kirketon back in September with my partner - It was his birthday and i wanted to surprise him. Prior to arriving i arranged for some small decorations to be placed in the room as part of the surprise - They had no problems in arranging the room for me. When we arrived we were checked in by a lovely fellow who insisted on carrying the bags up to our room which was on the second floor (as there was no lift). The room we booked was an executive room - (I was informed by reception that a premium or executive would be suitable for 2 people). This room was lovely, nicely set out with plenty of room for moving - It was dark which i assume is one of the main features of the hotel - Including the stairway and halls. The black and white movies playing in the halls were one feature i truely liked along with the mirrors running down the hall. There are not many Boutique hotel like this one around - The friendly staff, cool atmosphere and location would definately bring be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaSusskind
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was spectacular, comfortable and cheaper than most!!!! The staff were extremely friendly and the hotel was so central!!! Thank you to the kirketon for wanderful inner city living experience...i will deffinatley be back soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK, if you dont want room to move around”
Reviews.Author: AngAndAndy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kirketon for a 3 night stay in August 08. We were very pleased with the location, as it seemed to be in the middle of a good, lively location. We arrived quite early by hotel standards, so went in and asked if we could leave our bags. They had no problem with that and told us that our room would be ready by about 1pm, rather than 2pm if we wanted to return then. We had a wander around to get our bearings and had some breakfast. On our return just before 1, we were checked in by the very friendly receptionist and she helped us up to the first floor with our bags. ( there are NO lifts in this hotel). The stairs are carpeted in a different colour every step and not very well lit. Not a problem for us, but for someone with limited vision, I can foresee a potential tripping hazard there. At the top of the stairs on the first floor landing, is a wall mounted plasma tv with black and white movies ( no sound) playing. The reason for which is not obvious to me! The corridor with the double mirrors are quite wacky and fun, for the first 2 mins, but the novelty soon wears off! The corridors are again, like the stairs, dimly lit. On arrival into our room, we were shocked to see how tiny it was. Yet again, very dark, even with the lights on. ( black lampshades dont help) The Bed was comfortable. The window was frosted, but had to be really as it looked onto a covered area for a building that was VERY close to the hotel. Again, this added to the darkness of the room. There was a mirrored headboard in the room, which did what it could to make the room look bigger. There was also a seperate closet, containing the mini bar/dvd player for the tv, and hanging space for clothes.. Oh and the hospitality tray as well, but nowhere to plug the kettle in, so it had to be used in the main room anyway! There were 'pouffe' type seats in the room, but they were tiny and all but useless. The plasma screen tv was wall mounted at the top of the wall opposite the bed. The space between the end of the bed and the wall was RIDICULOUS. There cant have been more than 12 inches, and that is a very generous guess. It was so bad, one had to walk sideways to go past the end of the bed. I have also seen reviews on here saying that the hotel is outdated and management have defended these remarks saying that the hotel was to be fully refurbished and would be completely different and refreshed etc etc It wasnt... We stayed here the week it opened after the refurb.The quality of the finish was terrible. Paint all over the light switches, badly finished paintwork. It looked like it hadnt been sanded down for years and new paing had just been slapped on top of old paint. There was also paint peeling on the window frames ( pics supplied) To summarise... The location is fantastic, near to Kings Cross Tube Station, regular bus services and also the Hop On, Hop Off service. Lots of lovely boutique shops nearby and very reasonably priced and good quality bars and restaurants nearby. The location is the hotels saving grace, because the decor and quality/size of the room is a serious let down. I would definitely stay in this area again, but not this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious for a compact room”
Reviews.Author: BzzBzz
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Sydney early in the morning and was able to get my room immediately prior to normal check in time. Staff was friendly at check in. I had booked a "compact room" for 135 AUD/night. Compared to hotel rooms in e.g. London this room was actually quite roomy for one person. It had a separate walk in closet with ironing board, mini bar, safe. The batroom was also spacious for a small room. There was plenty of room to open a large suitcase on the floor and still room to walk around the bed, enter/exit room etc. Room was clean with good quality sheets. You could hear some noise from the room next door but it was not disruptive. Drawbacks; no view at all (frosted window and brick wall less than a meter from window). No lift, you have to carry luggage up one or two flights of stairs (staff offered to help with bags). Found small cockroach, but this is Australia so I guess those things are hard to avoid. Overall my impression was that the room was clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Not all bad yet not quite the hype either”
Reviews.Author: Archi-Traveler72
Reviews.Content: I was looking through the Wallpaper guide to Sydney and found a great description of The Kirketon as a great place for value and style in Sydney. While it was certainly stylish, I could immediately suspect that it was past its prime. Even so - the staff I encountered were very helpful and courteous. Very small base rooms but stylish in a minimalist way. Large wall mirror, built in stereo, bar, and rain shower were good touches but nothing luxurious. We found the location in Darlinghurst just fine and close to the train station and other neighborhood bars. That was good because both the bar and restaurant had recently closed so no luck there. Try the World Bar down the street! We stayed in 3 "Eight" hotels during our trip. The Cosmopolitan was definitely the best and the Pensione was the worst. IF you want small and cramped and NO style, try that one!

Reviews.Title: “I'm sorry to have been such an inconvenience!”
Reviews.Author: cbandem
Reviews.Content: Wow, the idea of a "boutique hotel" seems so romantic, doesn't it? Away from the mainstream, off the corporate conveyor belt, no loyalty cards or being upsold to spa packages at every opportunity... What "boutique" seems to translate to - at least with this hotel - is "complete lack of service or comfort". In fact, I'd like to apologise to the staff of the Kirketon for being such an inconveniece! Firstly, to the gentleman that checked us in: I so do hope that showing us to our room ("no, don't worry about taking our bags - we'll lug them up two flights off stairs ourselves") meant that you didn't miss out on your ebay auction. And I'm truly sorry for being so uninformed to as Sydney geography to even *dare* to ask directions to Oxford street - how silly of me not to bring my TomTom ("At rude and aloof receptionist, turn right and walk 200 metres..."). Gosh, you'd think I'd walked into the RSL and ask where the beer was. And to cap it off, check out was less than a breeze, where said receptionist does not acknowledge us in the slightest and instead spent his - albeit *very* valuable time - talking with another staff member regarding which staff drinks he wanted to comp off his tab. After dumping the keys on the front desk, the parting salvo from front desk? "Hey, what room were you in?" But you know what? I'm not sorry for this one... that's just woeful service. If only the heart ache stopped there. Granted, the hotel was being closed for refurbishment the day after we were leaving, but really? That's how you keep up with the times? Who uses a VCR these days? Cavemen? No, apparently the Kirketon's hotel's patrons. I loved the special touches as well - the fact that the VCR was *duct taped* (no joke!) to the underside of the circa 1992 television. I must admit, that I did have a giggle at the HiFi system. Here I was looking for a jack for my iPod, when I should have gone into my attic and brushed off my cassette collection. If only I had read the reviews posted on this site prior to booking. The only thing worse than an establishment that does not acknowledge feedback is an establishment that responds to feedback and does nothing about see "management response". Oh well, back to the Hilton for me. Cheers, Chris B P.S. I did forget to mention that we did receive good service. After having our keys disabled since we were 10 minutes late for check out (!), the cleaning lady was lovely and let us in. Or is that just another symptom of the rot that matches the decor?

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Zzzzzzzz4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a miserable experience... Firstly the staff are unprofessional, uninformed, and aloof. In one conversation that I overheard the desk staffer was arguing with a guest who had simply requested that a taxi be called...too difficult apparently. This response may have been brought on by the fact that the same guest had just complained about the hotel's wireless internet not functioning properly...Perhaps these people think that haughtiness is hip and cool and a necessary element of the designer/boutique brand experience? The restaurant...is it ever open? I could not get lunch nor breakfast. When I asked at the desk if breakfast was available - at 9am- the answer was "ah, like, I dunno, the restaurant looks shut today...but there are cafes across the street!" And the room...A single threadbare blanket was not enough to keep me warm, what about another blanket? Or two? As for the music system... eventually I discovered that it had been left on to welcome guests into the room...after I had spent the whole night being kept awake by what I thought was the television from the next room. It's sound quality was so poor, the location of speakers so inappropriate, and the volume which the staff had selected so low, that I could not distinguish it from what I thought was the next room's TV. There really is nothing much to like about this hotel...it is kept relatively clean but, it is tired and desperately in need of an overhaul...both of the building and the management. I note the management response below and wonder if it's author has a real grasp of what is going on at the Kirketon?

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go”
Reviews.Author: Dazar
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a romantic night in this "boutique" hotel. To find a very tired hotel with rooms more like jail cells. The room was bare except for a bed with an old looking blanket. It felt very cold and empty and was veyr dissapointing considering the price. When we talked to the man at reception he told us the rooms as the same as they are on the web and we had seen the pictures there. We would have to pay full price for the night. He made us pay $2 for phone calls to get a room at the fabulous STORRIER hotel around the corner. Was rude and made no attempt to rectify the situation. I would never stay here again nor recommend anyone stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Basic & Noisy”
Reviews.Author: gorka
Reviews.Content: A very basic hotel in Sydney. Location is convenient for King Cross, Oxford street and restaurants in Victoria street , but about forty minutes walking from The Opera House. Rooms small and bugs in the toilett Very, very noisy at night with its bar playing music too loud ( which I think it is not correct in a hotel). When you arrive it looks a chic-posh-glamourous hotel but after ten minutes in your bedroom you realize it is just a two stars hotel dressed to look a four stars hotel I would not be back

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: timsdm
Reviews.Content: We were only staying 2 nights after arriving in Sydney so we weren't hugely worried about the hotel, we weren't to be disappointed. A good location very stylish. We arrived well before check - in time and the extremely helpfull chap on reception advised us that our room was next to be cleaned and would be ready in an hour - he took our bags for us and recommended the french cafe opposite for breakfast - which is very good. In all a great location for all of sydney and a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined my stay in Sydney ... rude staff, noisy, small drab rooms, poor location”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Oz_Traveller
Reviews.Content: My experience at this hotel was appalling from start to finish. The constant music with the thumping bass in the reception and bar area was really loud in my room. And even more annoying, there was never anyone in the bar .. the thumping music was purely for the staff's own pleasure I did mention the above to reception, but he didn't even acknowledge that I had spoken !! The bedroom was tiny, and there wa not enough room to even walk around the bed (had to squeeze by to get to bathroom). The tiny window was frosted up, so couldn't even see out. Its a taxi ride or bit of a walk to town, and its right beside the red light area. Have nothing positive to say about my stay there. Would NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as it looks on their website”
Reviews.Author: TRB
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the common areas are wonderful and attractive, the food was good, but the rooms.... You don't see photos of their rooms on their website, because few would stay here if they saw in advance how drab they are. Gray walls, gray ceiling, gray bedding, gray window coverings, absolutely no artwork to break up the drab appearance of the tiny 8'Â± x 12'Â± room. Even the bathroom is gray except for the fixtures and the black shower curtain. The only tiny window is frosted gray too. My photos tell the story best. PS: The carpet is red!

Reviews.Title: “For the young or the deaf”
Reviews.Author: JanetKaye
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the other reviewers that the hotel is very well located, has a nice decor and the staff and service are perfect. It's true the standard room is a bit claustrophobic. You only want to be there to sleep and the problem is you can't. Music is blaring from the restaurant downstairs all day and late into the night. Friday is even better : a disco so loud it makes the furniture tremble. We're 50 years old and not night-clubbers so we ended up tired all the time on our holiday to Sydney. We wouldn't go back or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Depends what you are looking for”
Reviews.Author: tibbrit2
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the beginning and end of our Australian trip. The first time was in a standard room - these are small! - if you have a lot of luggage, this probably isn't for you. Second time we paid extra for a de luxe room - a lttle bigger, but not enormous. Decor is "Modernist" - lots of black - think W on a budget. Location is convenient - near Kings Cross travel facilities but away from the sleaze and the neighbohoods of Darlinghurst and Paddington in wlking distance. Great coffee shop for breakfast acroos the road. There is a new restaurant in the hotel but we didn't try it - too many other good places to eat in Sydney. There is no elevator but friendly reception staff happy to carry your bags. Overall we liked the Kirketon and thought it was good value for a city hotel but if you're into de luxe, go somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Great location and overall good, but in need of a little TLC”
Reviews.Author: bbowler
Reviews.Content: The Kirketon is a small boutique hotel in the Darlinghurst neighborhood of Sydney. Great location for being close to downtown, but not right in the financial district. Very convenient to lots of restaurants and cafes, close to the public transport etc... Overall the location was great. The hotel itself is a little tired. The A/C worked, but the remote was a bit touch and go. We stayed there twice during our vacation - different room both times - and in the bathrooms in both rooms were in need of some TLC. In one, the door handle to the bathroom was broken and the paint was peeling off the ceiling in the shower. In the other, the shower was kind of falling out of the ceiling. Speaking of the shower, it was a rainfall type shower - great except for the fact that the stall was so small there wasn't anywhere to move your head out of the water so that you could look for the shampoo or see what you were doing. Nice fluffy towels and nice shampoo etc... helped make up for that. The bedrooms were very, very small. Barely enough room for the double bed and the wardrobe. But we were in one of their cheaper rooms so perhaps the other rooms are bigger. Absolutely no view from the room at all - in fact the window was frosted over as there is literally nothing to see - just the wall of the neighboring building 5 feet from the room. The bed was comfy, nice pillows, nice and clean bed linens. 24 hour front-desk service was very helpful. We arrived at 8am - the room wasn't ready of course, but we left our luggage and went exploring. When we returned, our room was ready and our bags had been taken upstairs to the room. That was a nice touch. Wireless internet was available, but like most other hotels we visited, it cost extra. All in all, I'm glad we stayed there because of the location and in general it was a comfortable night's sleep. But they need to invest a bit in the place to bring it back up to it's original standard.

Reviews.Title: “funky hip quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: DownunderSugarglider
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Kirketon for 2 nights when on a business trip. the hotel has been refurbished to be very modern, sleek, minimalist in design - but it is not expensive looking - more like clever use of paint, tiles and package furniture. unfortunately you can't park on site - they do have a small number of secure parking spaces available in a nearby carpark (and I saw a number of broken into cars in the streets nearby - so i was glad for the secure parking - even though I had to walk around the block). There is a restuarant/bar next door - unfortunately not open the 2 days I was there so I went out for all meals. The lock on my door was a bit dodgy but the really friendly staff taught me how to slam the door shut to lock it. Although they hadn't taught the cleaners that - but fortunately nothing was missing from room when I came back and discovered the door unlocked. The window blind was broken, the bathroom shelf was too narrow to balance the electric jug or the professional sized hairdryer. the pillows were really uncomfortable - BUT I was in a premium room which was an OK size. I overlooked the street and with double glazing the room was very quiet, the mattress was great, the TV (incl a couple of cable channels) was fine. Great rainforest HUGE showerhead. welcome choccies (yum) nice toiletries. Great placement - right near the Coke sign - one block walk to the action in Kings Cross. 2 blocks to the railway station and buses and taxis readily available. the staff were great - friendly helpful etc. I bought a special package - and thought that price was fair for the quality of the room. I do think their rack rate is HORRIBLY over priced - you could do WAY better in sydney if you have to pay their full price. Great location make it worthwhile. OH and no lift - I had to carry my luggage up 2 flights. OH - and I got free wireless internet as part of my package.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you are claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: elleMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reviewed as being fashionable and attractive to the fashionistas and groovy people; however, whilst the hotel staff were friendly and welcoming, the room - although only a standard room - was minute, with no window (well, there was a window, behind a blind - but it was opaque)and a tiny bathroom. This might not count in a 2 or 3 star hotel - in fact, it would be expected - but for a purportedly 4 star establishment, a little more space than just for a bed and a small table ( no matter how nattily the pillows were arranged on the mattress) should really be made somehow more clear. If grooviness is what is needed, then this hotel is for you; however, if you need light, air, and you are in any way claustrophobic, then a standard room at this place needs to be reconsidered. I checked in - and then checked out about 2 hours later, forfeiting my pre-paid account because I just could not stay in a room that was so tiny, or lie on the bed trying to watch a television suspended on a wall at an angle about 85 degrees over my head. I've been to Africa 5 times, and so do not scare easily, but this hotel room was a bridge too far for me. If you cannot handle small spaces, avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Got what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: Jess&Ian
Reviews.Content: After a trip around Australia this was our last stop for 4 nights before returning home. The Kirketon is very stylish and we loved the reception and restaurant decor (check out the amazing coffee machine). Staff very friendly and wouldnt let us carry our heavy suitcases up the stairs (there is no lift!) Our room was compact but had everything we needed but we felt it was slightly tired and needed a bit of a touch up. I think what made it feel a bit in need of some TLC, was the old TV & VCR. I couldnt understand why, in this day and age the room had a VCR! surely purchasing DVD's wouldnt be that expensive. The best part of the hotel is definalty the restaurant. we had a fantastic evening meal on our first night., they do great fresh pizza's and the naan bread selection starter was out of this world. If you are looking for a cheap and chic hotel you can do no wrong here. It is a good 30mins walk to the main sights of sydney but we enjoyed the walk everyday and if our legs couldnt hack it we got a taxi as they are relatively cheap. Not excellent but we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “chic and funky”
Reviews.Author: skatey
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, clean and a very cool vibe - what more could u ask for!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: alang2nevada
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly staff, clean room, great location. They give passes to a nearby gym for those who want to work out. The subway is within a few blocks. Plenty of places to eat in all directions. The reviews I had read were pretty good but the overall experience was better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “If you like your hotel to remind you of life on board a submarine...”
Reviews.Author: WhizzKidUK
Reviews.Content: ...then this is the hotel for you. Dark corridors. Narrow, steep stairs and no lift. Rooms painted in gun-metal grey, and bathrooms with black grout. Tired decor yes, chic and modern, no. This place is resting on the laurels of yesteryear. Yes, the reception staff are very pleasant and helpful, that I can say. Beware of the 'double' bed in the rooms ear-marked for single occupancy. They are very right, one person only, as you have to sleep diagonally to fit in the bed (and I am not a giant) precluding anyone else coming to visit you. The remote for the air conditioning in both rooms I visited had to be held up to the unit, obviating all the benefits of a remote control. Thin walls meant that all the horizontal pleasures going on next door could easily be heard. And yes, the mould and missing tiles in 315 are very much still in evidence. Currently, downstairs is a building site.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TashVictoria
Reviews.Content: The staff were very professional and had a friendly manner and were always willing to go out of their way to help us. We loved the hotel and its location, proving to be a great spot to explore the city from. Beautiful clean room with a very comfortable bed! We will back, and so will our friends!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so trendy anymore!!”
Reviews.Author: megey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Kirketon for only one night in June 2007. I live in Sydney and had read heaps of press over the years about the ultra trendy vibe going on at the Kirketon. Decided to stay as saw a cheap last minute rate and my husband and I were dining out that evening in a nearby restaurant ( the Victoria Room - fantastic). Check in was fine, slick no fuss but not friendly. Car park is around the back lane in another building - a bit dingy but the area is reknowned for its urban fringe appeal. Car parking is extra $25 overnight but the car wash across the road from the front entrance does it for $15. No lifts or bell desk so have to drag suitcases up dark, narrow staircase with small steps. On entry into room (303) we were a bit let down. It is tired - not ultra mod trendy. It would have been ultra stylish when it was renovated in 1999 but no work has been done since. Protective seal around door was flapping off, stains on carpet, blanket on bed bobbled and worn, tiles need re-grouting, furniture is scratched and chipped. Light in bath was brown with a rust residue. No DVD only a video and an old TV. Weird music playing when we entered and it comes from radio in the cupboard as it took me ages to find it to turn it off!! Only air con and it would not heat up so room quite cool temperature -wise. Yes there are Aveda amenities but only shampoo, conditioner and body wash no moisturiser which I thought a little cheap. Chocolates on arrival are 2 after dinner mint style chocs. Not much insulation so you can clearly hear what is going on in adjoining rooms and in the corridor. Overall fine, clean and convenient if you are doing an evening in Darlinghurst. It is not cutting edge any longer and I would personally rate it alongside a Holiday Inn or 3 star property. We had an executive ing size room and it was a good size. I disagree with previous reviewer as there are a lot of breakfast places nearby - go to the next street - Victoria St for 2 Sydney instituions, Tropicana and Bar Coluzzi also Bills darlinghurst, le petit creme and a host of others are within a1km radius but you most probably have to know where they are - just ask the desk for a recommendation. Also hotel restaurant re-opens in July 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I were back there now...”
Reviews.Author: Gorilla_Jones
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at the Kirketon. It's easy to find, a short distance from the King's Cross station - a quick walk to the restaurants and bars, but far enough away that it's quiet at night. The desk clerk gave me a discounted rate - lower than listed - without my asking. The room was stylish and artfully minimalist - the design used the space subtly and effectively, and there were nice touches like a top-notch stereo system. The bathroom, however, was the exact opposite: opulent and luxurious, with a great shower. Above all, I just enjoyed being in my room whenever I finally arrived back for the night, and I didn't feel like I paid too much for it. I'd love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but some niggles”
Reviews.Author: paulieuk
Reviews.Content: I first stayed here a couple of years ago and it was pretty much as I remembered, with each room pretty consistent so you always know what to get. So that means the rooms are small and pretty bare, with no window/view, but they're stylishly done (if that makes sense!), look nice and make good use of the space that is available and the bed is comfortable. However, as the management response to an earlier review says, they are planning to update the hotel and going on this last stay of mine, I'd agree that it's needed. And not just replacing the old vcr with dvd player (come on guys, they cost A$50!). I would dispute their claim that there is no mould in the bathrooms - there certainly was mould on the shower curtain in my room (315) which had curled at the bottom as a result. There were loose, broken and missing tiles on the bathroom floor too. Generally the bathrooms are still one of the best things about the rooms - stylish and practical. However, the flush on the toilet was also faulty - the cistern was empty when first I needed to flush and on removing the lid and tinkering to get the water flowing it never actually filled up, so the water constantly ran, meaning I had to tinker again to get it stop and allow me to sleep! I also failed to get the aircon control to work ("oh it's a bit difficult you have to point it at a certain angle from the corner of the room" was the reply at check-out) but that's no use when you're laying bed. The iron also left dirty marks on the sleeve of the shirt I tried to iron, as no-one had dealt with the dirty mark on the hotplate. I was promised a manager would call me about these issues as none was there at check-out... two days later I'm still waiting. So, if you can get a good rate (I paid A$119) and need somewhere that's stylish but only to lay your head and not to spread out or hang out in the room, then go for it and enjoy the Kirketon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Close to Kings Cross”
Reviews.Author: SBArules
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is located in a great spot, close to most anything you could need. I pretty much walked everywhere from here. Trains, taxi's and buses are all close. Many places to eat and markets nearby. When I arrived the kind woman at the desk helped me lug my suitcase up 2 long flights of stairs. (no lift) I don't know how I would have done it without her (and I work out). My room was nice, small but comfortable. There was no walk in closet as I read in one of the other reviews. But when I arrived there was classical music playing on the stereo in the room which was quite nice. The bathroom as grey tiled and with the dim lighting it was hard to see - especially in the shower. I also wish there had been a few hooks to hang things like towels and cosmetic case from. Internet access was available from your room if you had a laptop but it cost additional fees. I think it was $10 a day but can't remember. I took advantage of the use of a gym down the road. You pick up the pass at the front desk, show them at the gym, then drop the pass back at the front desk when you return. The gym was quite adequate and only about 5 blocks away. Mini bar in the room was crammed with things (for purchase) so if you want to put anything in of your own, you need to remove items and what you put in must be small as it is designed for extra small bottles. The bar/rest. was not open when I was there. When I needed a cab, the staff help hail one for me. Phone messages (all but one) were delivered to me. Everyone was very helpful. All the other places I stayed in Sydney & elsewhere in Australia were more economical but didn't offer the ammenities that the Kirketon had.

Reviews.Title: “Kirketon A+++++++++”
Reviews.Author: jodal
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Sydney, and so by extension my first time at the Kirketon Hotel. We stayed there on a recommendation from my parents who'd been there six months earlier and had loved it (this is saying something as they have tremendously high standards). We (my g'f and I) turned up to find the sweetest boutique hotel nestled in a great location in central Sydney. Staff met us with smiling faces and an unnatural willingness to help, anything we wanted to do they would sort for us and even get us a discount in some cases. The rooms were smart, clean and functional and the video library (in reception) was a lifesaver for the long and sleepless nights suffering from jet lag. We didn't manage to try the food in the adjoining restaurant but we did sample the bar menu which was fantastic (I won't even mention the amazing Mojito's which left us barely able to crawl up to our rooms).

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Quality”
Reviews.Author: PoolChamp2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kirketon for about a week a few months ago. Having never been to Sydney before, I was delighted to choose a place that was so easy to get to both the city sights and the beach. What I didn't realise is that the Hotel is also minutes away from some of the best pubs and restaurants in the city. The Hotel itself is very modern and stylish without sacrificing comfort for the aesthetics. The room was compact but there was still plenty of space to move around and to store all of our bags and clothes. I particularly liked that the rooms had a walk in closet and CD player. The staff were friendly and helpful, real people instead of the clones that tend to work in those huge hotels. it was a pleasant surprise to be remembered in the morning when we approached the desk. Overall, just a really good Hotel, up there with the best we went to while in Oz.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: geaelika
Reviews.Content: A true retreat in the middle of the hottest neighborhood in Sydney. I stayed at the kirketon in Dec and have to say that it made my trip a delightful pleasure. Aside from the affordable rates the hotel is a stylish hidden gem and the service is up to par for the most discerning traveler. From the comfortable beds to the cool lighting it made me feel like home. To my fellow travelers i advise you to stay and enjoy the kirketon if you want to experience the pulse of sydney's culture from the nightlife, fabulous galleries and best of all the best coffee in sydney across the street at the colluzi bar. Gea Elika

Reviews.Title: “Better the second time around”
Reviews.Author: Denir0
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Kirketon for the first time a couple of years ago when the new management had just taken over and was happy with it then. Now, a couple of years on, I am even more impressed as it has undegone a refurb since the last time I was here, and my stay was even more comfortable. First thing you encounter on arrival apart from the cool and funky lobby, is the really friendly helpful staff. Needed some information on arrival and they were only too happy to help. The position of this hotel is ideal. Right on the edge of the city CBD (1 train stop), walking distance (2 min) to the best restaraunts and bars/clubs in Sydney (Kings Kross) and 10 min walk to Oxfrord Street if fashion is your thing. The Kirketon is fantastic value for money and overall an extremely enjoyable expereince. If you are after a cosy, cool boutique hotel in a great position with really friendly staff and without the attitude, I highly recommend this great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, hip, Unique - Everything Darlinghurst is about”
Reviews.Author: E&YLondon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Kirketon for 2 weeks in March. It was our 2nd stay, and as with our previous visit we were not disappointed. The Kirketon has a funky vibe that matches Darlinghurst to a tee. The rooms are beautifully fitted out, with style and comfort in mind. The location of The Kirketon is fantastic, situated on a tree lined street, you are a stones throw away from all the best bars, restaurants and shops in Sydney. The staff are first rate and went out of their way to help us, one night even getting us a take away to have in our room! To sum up - it's a unique hip hotel, in the best location in Sydney for a great price - what is there to complain about?

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: muirdigital
Reviews.Content: Couldn't find a bed at my favourite hotel, was directed to Hotel Kirketon in Darlinghurst.......Fantastic!, amazing service, staff bent over backwards for any request.....Highly Recomended. Paul Muir

Reviews.Title: “5 star?? Maybe 2”
Reviews.Author: Carlins123
Reviews.Content: Had read about this "cool" hotel, Traveller's top 50 etc. What a disappointment. Dark, dingy, not clean, no public areas, no lift, although staff did assist with luggage, not one chair you could actually sit on in the stark (=basic) room, although there was an "artistic" metal contraption that I don't think had ever had anyone's backside on it, and a wooden child-size chair that must have come from a kindergarten. The bed was reasonably comfortable, thank God, as there was nowhere else to sit/rest. Not one shelf/drawer to unpack clothing. Totally impractical. And this was the "executive level" room. Bathroom basic, putting the shower direct into the ceiling just means that the ceiling is now collapsing with moisture that can't escape. Mouldy grouting around bath. The room smelt of cat urine??? It may have just been the leaking sink, floor constantly wet. Antique carpet, probably a health hazard. No milk for tea/coffee. It is absolute rubbish to pretend that this is 5-star, 2 is more accurate. We have travelled widely and 2-star can be fine if that is what you expect and are paying for, not the case here. A rip-off, hiding behind Sydney's repute for trendiness/quirkiness, which here is just an excuse for lack of maintenance and slovenliness. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Visitors from Europe”
Reviews.Author: reisenaustralien
Reviews.Content: My partner and I, originally from Germany, are living for 1.5 years in Melbourne now! Being used to european standards, we do find it hard to find very good accommodation for a decent price when we do travel in Australia! The Kirketon Design Hotel in Sydney is one of those hotels where we love staying when we come up to Sydney! The Kirketon is refreshingly clean, stylish and stuf is very friendly! It is located in one of the best areas from where you can approach everything easily! Public transport is around the corner! Treat yourself! Sina Velke

Reviews.Title: “On its way out”
Reviews.Author: FelixSydneyAustralia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in April and was very disappointed to say the least. I had heard great things about this hotel, that it was kirky, hip and happening. I am from Sydney myself, actually live just around the corner in Paddington, but felt like a special night out. The restaurant in the hotel (I think it was named Salt) has gone bust and I feel that the hotel is on its way too. There was only one staff, he didn't help with the luggage, there is no lift and two sets of stairs. The room was old and tired, although I could see that it used to be hip, bathroom was pretty, but a lot of things just needed replacement. It felt like people smoked in the hotel although it was a non smoking hotel, as advertised. We were trying to arrange a wake up call, but there was nobody at the desk anymore. Beds were good, and we did have a good night sleep, and the location is great I must say. Parking is very difficult or expensive. I would not stay again, but hey I might be a bit of a princess who is used to five star treatment......you are warned.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to visit again”
Reviews.Author: SJHLondon
Reviews.Content: We visited the Kirketon Hotel in December last year and had a fantastic time. From the moment we arrived we were given outstanding treatment by the hotel staff. The rooms were lovely - unique, comfortable, stylish and very clean. The shower was amazing, and we were able to use the hotel's range of movies, wireless internet access, and top of the range stereo with surround sound. When we arrived our luggage was taken straight to the room, and when we entered the air conditioning was already on with music in the background. The customer service was brilliant - the hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. They provided local knowledge, recommendations, and advice as well as maps and suggestions of activities. They even booked a haircut for us, and the Sydney harbour bridge climb. We would definately recommend the Kirketon as a fantastic boutique hotel. It made our stay in Sydney enjoyable, and we have never experienced such great customer service. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “So hip !”
Reviews.Author: BENOITBDB
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, hip atmosphere, lots of little details / attentions which make the difference !

Reviews.Title: “Past its sell by date”
Reviews.Author: SnapperUK
Reviews.Content: We were encouraged to consider this hotel by the 'hype' on their web site, which is overrated. The staff are certainly friendly and helpfull but the decor of the rooms is drab, carpets dirty and furnishings minimal. The bathrooms could do with a good scrub as there is mould everywhere, and we sampled 3 rooms during our two stays. Although there are only two floors the absence of a lift is a hassle with luggage. The day before we arrived the restaurant and bars had closed - a misfortune when the hotel has no control over who runs them. They have no idea when they may re-open. The atmosphere was, therefore, lacking, it is a dark, dreary and dead hotel and I wouldn't recommend it. The location is ok if you like being near Kings Cross....but on the upside the restaurants in Victoria St are fairly good and Bill Grainger's is within walking distance. I understand they have dropped their prices and can see why.

Reviews.Title: “ignore the bad reports”
Reviews.Author: 2londonguys
Reviews.Content: I cannot belive some of the negative reviews posted on this site regarding the kirketon. my partner and ihave stayed here twice and on both occasions found it a really great place to spend some time. the decor is fabulous. a modern delight obviously not to the taste of some who clearly prefer the frills and chintz of so many other so-called top hotels. rooms are clean tidy and functional. the location is brilliant, so close to the action of oxford street, paddington, surry hills etc. great cafes and bars nearby make it our fave place in sydney. we have no connection to this hotal but thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the price”
Reviews.Author: ChazInLA
Reviews.Content: The Kirketon Hotel is an excellent value for the price. Although our room was very small (typical by European standards), it had a walk-in closet with mini bar, and a medium sized bathroom. The style was minimalist, which echoed the dÃ©cor of the public rooms. There was a stereo/cd player that had classical jazz when we arrived, and a comfortable bed (we had a premium room). I think the room probably could have used a little art on the walls, and I donâ€™t think we had a clock. The property is very well located about 3 blocks from the Kingâ€™s Cross subway stop, and about 4-5 blocks from the cafÃ©â€™s, clubs and restaurants of Oxford Street. The staff was very courteous and helpful, especially Adrian who gave us several excellent restaurant recommendations! He also recommended seeing the musical Pricilla Queen of the Desert, which was very fun. The staff arranged getting our tickets, made dinner reservations, provided maps, etc. This very personal attention is what gives the Kirketon an edge over a chain hotel, or a larger property.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: fabricoffolly
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the Kirketon for three nights in late December and had a fantastic time. Yes, the room was on the small side (as indeed are most of the hotel's communal areas) and lacked a view but stylish design and the strategic use of mirrors make the spaces seem bigger than they really are. Our bathroom was also modestly proportioned although the undersized bath was more than compensated for by the ceiling-mounted drop shower which feels like standing under a waterfall (in a good way). A bigger issue than the size of the room was the noise, both from the air-con unit outside and the other guests (the walls/floors are not well insulated for sound) although it wasn't loud enough to keep us awake for long after a hard days sight-seeing in Sydney. The bed was very comfortable and the cleaning staff did a great job of keeping the room immaculate and the bathroom stocked with Aveda products. Reception has a decent selection of videos which you can watch in your room although the the bulky CRT TV and video recorder could do with being upgraded to a flat-screen TV and DVD player. Perhaps the biggest selling point of the Kirketon is the staff who were uniformly friendly and helpful allowing us a late check out and looking after our bags on the afternoon of our departure. Adrian, in particular, went out of his way to offer advice and assistance. The hotel's location is also a boon. Just a short walk from Kings Cross and a number of great eateries along Darlinghurst Road (we had a lovely meal at Fish Face about 2 mins from the hotel). We ate in the hotel bar one evening and the food was delicious (although service was a little slow). Whether you would enjoy a stay at the Kirketon depends entirely on what you're looking for (hence the broad range of ratings in other reviews). If you're after a spacious room with a view then I'd suggest looking elsewhere. If, however, you're after a friendly, stylish base from which to explore Sydney then the Kirketon should be right up your street. Well worth the AUD $165.00 a night we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: S_Wills+J_Buckwell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in early December when visiting family. We used to live in Sydney so already knew this hotel has a great location, very handy to transport and local cafes (useful bc they don't provide breakfast.) We'd seen pics of the inside, which photographs very well. However the reality is that the designer decor is sadly not wearing that well, many of the rooms are dark and poky (inc ours - allegedly a premium room!), and our bathroom shower was a bit grubby (maybe it's too dark for the cleaners too!) Prices are on the expensive side of average, but don't be fooled that you're getting a designer room - it may have been designer in its day, but sadly it seems now the Kirkton is nothing more than average. We asked to use the wireless broadband which costs $10 a day â€“ which also seems a bit cheeky when the broadband speed we got was quite slow. We will probably stay elsewhere on our next visit. (if it wasn't for the location we'd definitely stay elsewhere.)

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, so-so rooms”
Reviews.Author: paestum70
Reviews.Content: I was prepared having read the previous posts which generally give a pretty accurate picture of the hotel. Yes, the photos on the website are sexy. Yes, the reality is different. But at the same time to find a hotel in Sydney for AUD159 or less is pretty amazing. The rooms I had (had to switch because of noise) were a bit smelly (carpets needed cleaning desperately) and the cleaners did a pretty bad job in general (i.e. not washing the bathroom floor, etc...) The staff was excellent- Adrian in particular was very helpful. One annoying-and deceptive- practice of the hotel- beware- is their agreement with Travelex to charge you in your own currency at an inflated exchange rate. Insist on paying in Australian dollars!!!!! The hotel calls it a "convenience"...the reality is that your home country will still charge the same foreign currency rate even if it is in your currency...

Reviews.Title: “Great staff & location”
Reviews.Author: John_at_large
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Kirketon mid November for 3 nights with my wife. The rooms are small, but they are very stylishly appointed. The shower is a fixed dish flush with the ceiling. Although with a severe drought in Sydney, youâ€™ll have to resist the temptation to stay under the downpour too long. My better half loved the complimentary Aveda products on offer in the bathroom Location is great to enjoy cafes & bars. Stanley St. is just a short stroll away for a great selection of restaurants. Prior to arriving at the hotel, my bag went missing with my airline. The staff could not have been more accommodating in assisting in getting it back and also offered advice on where to eat/drink etc. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I am Planning to stay agian”
Reviews.Author: Kiffs68
Reviews.Content: I am in the process of planning a trip back to Sydney this November after a fantastic trip last year. I am writing a review now after seeing the bad review given by another visitor, totally wrong i might add. The hotel was excellent, superb location close to pretty much every where, we walked to everything in Sydney (not always back though) Kings Cross right next door, loads of excellent restaurants and bars a few minues away, and the tube if your feeling tired. The hotel is exeptionally clean, smart and well planned. Yes it is small but we fitted everything in and moved about quite freely in a standard room, the bathroom, well what can you say, wish i had one at home. A point to make is that i travelled 30 hours door to door to see Sydney so was out with my wife a lot, If you go to Sydney to stay in a hotel room then maybe you need to go else where. The staff were really helpful and polite, The only problem we had was late night noise from another room (from the great stereos in each room) it was obviously a party so we left it til very late but then asked staff to sort out. It was sorted in minutes, enough said as far as i am concerned. I will definitly be going back and recommend it to everyone, Ignore ignorant reviewers. By the way the Bar and restaurant weren't finished when we were there so can't wait to see what it's like now, better i assume.

Reviews.Title: “HAD AN AWESOME STAY”
Reviews.Author: enjoyastay
Reviews.Content: i HAVE BEEN A COUPLE OF TIMES AT THE KIRKETON AND ALWAYS HAD A GREAT STAY. The staff is superb and so helpful!they are young and enthusiastic. It is easy to feel welcome there. The rooms are quite small, but they have more than you need.And the beds are awesome. you can sleep like a king. Unfirtunately they don#t have a view but who would like to sit inside the room while there is so much going on outside, especially in this area?! I've also never had a shower like that.the bathrooms are small as well,but the shower is an excuse!could shower for ages... another reason to go there is the restaurant.With its stylish interior the kirketon is especially for young people or for those who feel young! A big plus is the multilingual staff! french,german,english...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - great location. Overpriced though.”
Reviews.Author: rrrjjjmmm
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Kirketon for a quick weekend girly getaway to Sydney. Nice exterior, very trendy. Location was really handy. We booked an Executive room, which was lucky, because that wasn't huge. But it was fine. Bathrooms were nice, shower was delicious. We like the stereo being the in the room. Bit dissapointing to open our hotel window and be overlooking cooling vents and airconditioners and nothing else. No lift, so you have to clamber up the stairs but that's okay. No room service, but there is a fantastic place just through the other side of the road called Morgans. Really nice. Mini-bar was super-dooper expensive, even by hotel standards. I would stay there again, but would try to find a cheaper rate than $189 pn for exec room, as that was probably overpriced and we could've got a fancier hotel for just slightly more money if we'd booked on Wotif. Again, can't fault the location. Recommend, but know what you're getting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at The Kirketon. Good clean rooms, nice and quiet and enjoyed being within walking distance of both the city and local neighbourhood restaurants. We enjoyed a few drinks in the bar too and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed at the Executive Room with an added cot. Raves: 1) location unbeatable: internet access 1 min walk, medical centre/pharmacy 1 min, car rental (charter drive) 30 secs, great cafes/restaurants 2 mins, convenience store 2 mins... 2) staff very friendly and helpful; look for Adrian 3) bathroom very spacious 4) they give you Aveda products 5) room itself very spacious even with 3 people Complaints: 1) no elevator; had to drag heavy luggage up 2 flights of stairs 2) blanket had lots of lint (being picky here) 3) used cups never washed/replaced The noise problem wasn't bad maybe because we stayed at the end of the hall on the top floor. The works didn't start until well after 9 am.

Reviews.Title: “getting tired now”
Reviews.Author: Steviem71
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the Kirketon 4 or 5 times but think this time may be my last. Nothing has changed and therein lies the problem. In a fast moving city such as Sydney then you need to be improving all the time just to keep up and sadly the Kirketon is in need of some overdue TLC. From the scuffed walls to the broken window to the dirty grout in the bathroom tiles it was clear our room had seen better days. Add to this the constant noise from the restaurant refurb, even during the Easter holidays, and I was glad to the weather was so nice and we didn't have to spend much time in the room itself. If they spend some money on bringing the place back up to scratch then I may give it another go but in future I'll stay across the road at the Darlo Bar for half the price.
